Reviews.Title: “The best view”
Reviews.Author: CijN
Reviews.Content: Had one night here. Arrived from uk at 6.30am but could not get room until two hours later. But what a view. Great room beautifully renovated and pool on top of hotel. Shame about noise coming fom bridge from building work in progress. So not very relaxing by pool.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Views!”
Reviews.Author: Bohemian2011
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for us to enjoy the view of the Opera House. It was his 2nd and my first trip to Sydney. Enjoyed our 2 night stay at Park Hyatt. Good: Particularly loved the brilliant views of the harbor and the Opera House. Our room was elegant and tastefully decorated. Loved the nice comfortable bed and ever fluffy towels which were changed twice a day. The hotel is located in the Rocks and many tourist attractions are in short walking distance, including the Harbor Bridge, Opera House, and the recently reopened the Museum of Contemporary Art. Bad: No free Wi-Fi. Two unpleasant incidents-- Guest staying in the room above us failed to use ashtray while smoking on the balcony. When we approached the balcony to enjoy the glorious morning sun in the balcony, we were terribly disappointed with the mess on our chairs. While this unsightly views of ashes were cleaned up later by the cleaning staff, it happened again on the 2nd day. I do acknowledge that this is not entirely the fault of the hotel, however, this should not have happened as our rooms are designed to be 'non-smoking'. Second, having walked around the town all day, we came back to the hotel in the late afternoon to rest till dinner. We were surprised to find a waste basket on top of the table and all the used teacups and glasses were still there. This was handled swiftly once we notified the reception. Have to admit that this was totally disappointing. If you are in Sydney for the first time and are looking for a hotel with dazzling views of the Opera House, I could highly recommend Park Hyatt. The view was stunning in the morning sun, at sunset, and under the moon. However, the overall experience of the hotel did not wow me except for the views -- at least not as much as I had expected from reading all the reviews. Good but not that great --It was pleasant just as much as at other five star hotels in general. If I were to go back to Sydney again for holiday, I would look for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good! But not the best Australia has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: madmelbourne
Reviews.Content: I was eagerly anticipating my stay at the newly refurbished Park Hyatt Sydney as I had heard good reviews and that it has Australia's best guest rooms. Well I was disappointed!!! The lobby is tiny, unimpressive and is an impersonal desk stuck in the middle of the main walkway of the hotel!! However I could not fault the service at check-in as the staff where impeccable at the front desk. The rooms are nice but lack that real sense of class that the hotel says and thinks it has. The furniture in the room was nice but nothing great, there's an arm chair in the room that just looked like a nicer version of an ikea arm chair. The breackfast was very good, probably the best thing about the hotel, however I ordered room service one night and they forgot a couple of things and I had to call them to bring them up. At$900 a night for your basic standard room the hotel is very very very overpriced!!! Yes the location is nice. Yes the service is good. But this hotel does not have Australia's best guest rooms and the hotel shouldn't boast that it does!!! I don't mind paying $900 a night for a hotel room and I have done so many times the world over, but Im sorry Park Hyatt Sydney you are not worth much a night!!

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt Sydney--Not Where It Should Be, But Has Potential”
Reviews.Author: jmleon72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt Sydney for 7 days in March. With respect to the property, it has an unrivaled location on the harbor with magnificent views of the Opera House, CBD skyline and cruise ships. Our room was tastefully decorated and modern. The property has undergone a complete renovation and parts of the hotel were still under construction. For example, some guest rooms were still gutted and you could hear the construction noise from our room at times and work around the gym and pool was still ongoing (the roof top spa was out of order, gym toilets wouldn't flush and construction equipment was left in the gym corridor leading to the pool). It was particularly disturbing that management failed to notify us in advance of the ongoing construction (we were really looking forward to using the rooftop spa). Additionally, in some ways it felt like some of the details were slapped together without much care. For example, the safe in our room broke and it took several people several hours to fix the problem; the emergency exit sign on our room door fell off; an emergency exit sign in the hallway fell off the wall too and wasn't replaced during our stay; part of the smoke detector fell off the ceiling in our room and wasn't fixed during our stay; and disturbingly and frighteningly, the hotel-wide emergency alarm went off early one morning. As for the service, it was mixed with some notable good and bad exceptions which for a property as nice and expensive as the Park Hyatt is overall disappointing. At check-in the staff made a fuss that the manager wanted to greet us personally, so we waited and the manager came to front desk, but never bothered to follow through and speak to us. Our room was not ready when we arrived and they told us to have a drink or go out. Instead we said we'd like to workout. They took us to the gym and told us they'd collect us when the room was ready. They never came and we had to go back and inquire about our room's status. Also, they didn't bother to show us any of the new amenities or explain our Diamond amenities. Management should train staff to ALWAYS ring the bell before entering the room. One day I hurt my ankle while out walking and returned to the room a little early. I had removed all my clothing and was walking to the shower when our butler walked in and I was completely naked. There was no bell ring or knock. I heard the key swipe and then the door opened! This was extremely embarrassing and a complete violation of privacy. Staff should always ring the bell (even with the privacy light is not on). I suspect some of the staff are new but this should be one of the first things they are taught to do. One other point worth mentioning is that the turn down and housekeeping service is really odd. The staff would tidy the room, but wouldn't clear used dishes. It seems that the butlers were responsible for clearing dishes, but we noticed that sometimes our dirty dishes and barware were moved from the table to the minibar area and then back to the table. The result being that sometimes used dishes remained in the room for up to 2 days. One suggestion would be that management instruct all staff members--butlers or housekeeping--to remove any dirty dishes whenever they see them. Otherwise, relying on the joint efforts of the butlers and housekeeping to maintain a room produces disjointed results and it's a little unpleasant to come back to a clean room with a table full of dirty dishes. Also we noticed that housekeeping doesn't use the big trolleys that you typically see in a hotel and as a result, it seems that they have no capacity for clearing dishes or restocking small items like shampoo, conditioner, note pads or bath salts. We'd often arrive back to the room after a long day and we'd have to call for shampoo/conditioner & bath salts. So perhaps management could provide housekeeping with a fully stocked trolley. Overall, we were disappointed with our stay, but believe that once they sort out their start-up issues the Park Hyatt Sydney could once again be top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt Delicious and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wendywanda
Reviews.Content: For a beautiful breakfast with a view visit the Park Hyatt. Fully renovated and open again it is delicious elegant and ... I want one of those fridges!!! Beautiful service which is good to enjoy in this city and a treat to find And food was delicious with the best view! Oh and try MCA Cafe for a view too!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Harbour at its best”
Reviews.Author: Howdizzy
Reviews.Content: We booked interconnecting city Harbour rooms for a family with four young children for a four night stay in April. It is by far the best option for a Sydney stay in terms of location and five star experience. We had tried to book the deluxe rooms because they were bigger but they were booked out and two standard rooms at 40m2 were absolutely fine even for a family of six, newly renovated and lovely view of the city, ferries and a square rigged sailing ship recalling the Rocks' history. It is an intimate setting as opposed to looking down from a distance at the city's goings on from the Four Seasons or Shangri-la glass windows. The view was only marred by a huge cruise ship that docked on our last morning. Perhaps the Opera rooms don't have this problem. Check in was smooth and we were able to shower in the gym when we were not able to check in early. Concierge were lovely but a mixed bag in terms of experience like the rest of the staff at the hotel. We heard one of them say some odd things to tourists (we are former Sydney residents) such as telling another young family that a trip to Taronga zoo would only take 2-3 hrs (not with kids in tow!) and then they could lunch at Doyles (it is easy to spend a day at the zoo and Balmoral Bathers Pavillion which is on the same side of the harbour as the zoo would have been a more memorable option). Doyles is okay - fish and chips, a bit of a Sydney institution and needs a facelift - but there are other more up to the minute options nearby (MCA rooftop cafe, Sake). Eatability.com lists restaurants with chefs' hats which is a pretty reliable indicator of good food. The fine food company (for breakfast or coffee) is great as is Baroque for dinner - both around the corner from the hotel and recommended by a staff member. Ferry ride is a must - Darling Harbour (maritime museum, aquarium and fab playground), Luna Park (tacky amusement park), Balmain East or Mosman Bay (playground by the Harbour), Zoo etc are all a ferry ride away from the hotel. The rooftop pool was like a welcome warm bath. Breakfast was good but again, service was mixed (Antoine and Isis stood out for us as consummate professionals). For example, coffee took a long time to arrive on most mornings we were there and when we queried one morning where it was after waiting 10 minutes, we were told 'it is made from scratch' - laughable! However, there were only ever minor blips and none of the sassy attitude that you get from others in the city's service industries. Instead, there were so many small gestures from staff to make our stay a pleasure that we really felt very privileged to be there. Room Service menu was excellent. Afternoon tea scones were delicious. Most importantly for us, our children were always welcomed (thank you for the gifts and I loved the organic bath amenities- thank you!). Overall, a very intimate re-introduction to Sydney in all it's glory (Opera House, Harbour Bridge, the historical Rocks area, Ferry rides, the Botanic Gardens and city shops all on your doorstep and shiny, happy people to welcome you).

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: Being a Hyatt fan, have stayed in about 30 of them mostly Park Hyatts for business and pleasure. This is up there with the best medium sized city hotels in the world. Views to die for and the service uniformly good and everything else is of the standard you would expect of a 5 star hotel in the price range. The main restaurant is not top class but is rarely find that in hotels that can also cater for business. But the hotel is in walking distance of Some of Sydney's best. The evening and morning view of the harbour across to the opera house is worth travelling the world to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Spectacular Location, Service w/A Smile!”
Reviews.Author: RussFilice
Reviews.Content: Could not be a better place. The hotel is spectacular in it's simplicity. Clean, new, fresh rooms with iconic Sydney Views that you can almost reach out and touch. The interior design is superb an inspirational. Rooms are gracious with baths you wont want to leave. Check-in for a night and you will want to stay forever.... Christian, Mike, Tim, Leon, Bianca, the entire staff - you guys make the place feel like home. Nothing compares. Pride in ownership and performance before profit. A perfect 10!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking, both inside and out!”
Reviews.Author: JTandP
Reviews.Content: They've recently renovated the Park Hyatt Sydney, and the results are truly spectacular! Rooms have gorgeous harbor views, most of which include the Opera House! The rooms are sleek and sophisticated and luxurious and extremely user-friendly, and the food is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos for the staff”
Reviews.Author: CAKathryn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, the service is the best that we have ever experienced anywhere, and everything about the hotel is first class. There are a few things that still need to be worked out. Since they have recently reopened, in all fairness, it doesn't feel fair to be too judgmental. A special note of appreciation to the assistant manager, Leon Mendels, who made staying at the Park Hyatt Sydney a most positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a stunning location”
Reviews.Author: MSW2
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt completely lived up to it's 5 star status. The hotels recent renovation has created a cosy yet elegant environment. The hotel staff are superb, we had a few small issues during our stay but they dealt with it brilliantly. The rooms are simply gorgeous and offer sublime views of the Sydney opera house. The rooftop pool is also excellent and offers a great vista. We used the hotel restaurant one morning, the food was lovely and not too over priced for a 5 star. The only problem with this hotel is that it will heighten your expectations of all other 5 star hotels. We will without doubt stay at this excellent hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jess G
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came here for breakfast and could not have been happier. The service is prompt, friendly and professional. The waitresses and waiters did everything they could to make sure we were happy and comfortable. The food was delicious, my order was a bit specific with dietary needs, however the staff made sure they were all met. The view is beautiful, food lovely and good coffee. I am big on good customer service and fresh food and the park Hyatt delivered a 10/10 experience, I will returning for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: AngelaSch
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel - from the moment I arrived I was surrounded by welcoming staff. The room type I had booked was not available so I was offered complimentary breakfast. My views were not great - but the large room, with comfortable bed and huge bathroom more than made up for it. It is an expensive hotel, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: debbie1759
Reviews.Content: This is truly a 5 star hotel. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, however we were offered complimentary coffee/juice while we waited.The staff were wonderful and the rooms themselves were top notch. The balcony outside our room overlooking the Sydney Opera House was an unexpected bonus and we loved starting our day drinking our coffee admiring the view. We used our Hyatt points for this stay which was well worth it. I would recommend staying here if you want to be close to everything in Sydney Harbor. There's enough shops and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “An Iconic Legend returns with triumphant Style & Class”
Reviews.Author: frequentstaydude
Reviews.Content: Arrival/Greeting I am a long time guest of this hotel and a top tier member of Hyatt Gold Passport so my experience may differ than others though I doubt all that much at the end of the day Within a minute or two my arrival I was surrounded by warm welcomes from the front of the house by both of the front office managers (These folks are sensational ) Then to my complete and utter surprise a brief greeting and welcome from the GM himself as we approached the elevators. Guests are escorted to their rooms by hosts/front desk Ambassadors not bellman which may be more typically a front office manager. If I've observed anything about the new Park Hyatt Sydney it is an overwhelming desire/commitment to please guests like never before With one glaring exception of its past business decision of no suite upgrades for Hyatt top tier members a policy which sadly still remains firmly in place On the other hand each guest is treated with the highest regard for room upgrades and all other amenities here including the unexpected and random acts of kindness and generosity from mostly amazing professional well groomed attractive team members Moving on................ The Butler is Back!!! Itâ€™s not just advertising itâ€™s the first time in 15 years I actually had one show up at the door. For those that have not had such luxuries they are truly a great asset providing you with any special services during your stay. Packing or unpacking and a wide variety of assistance are offered.Regretfully my short stay didnâ€™t make use of this exceptional service. The Room Upon entry of the long and winding corridors which have some nice new touches including enhanced hallway lighting I arrived at my upgraded room 244. I am a huge fan of the simple rectangular door handles of polished chrome and the simple state of the art room key entry system. Simple, effective and effortless. Have been looking at a similar design for my new residence. The large well-appointed room two exceptional all glass balconies(no obstruction remain anymore) with good views of the Opera House It took a while to understand the rooms architectural design The rooms do not have the wow dramatic factor of say Andaz Wall Street New York City that I have come to favour. In fact in some areas it is a slightly lesser overall room product with some exceptions. Iâ€™m speculating the designers wanted to achieve an understated yet tasteful contemporary design that wouldnâ€™t compete with the view which is the main event at this property clearly. In that regard Iâ€™d say that the designers got it right. The rooms are certainly more functional and contemporary then in the past and as other long time guests have noted slightly fuller of furniture making rooms seem a bit smaller. Impressive are the mirrored and wood light up closets(beautifully lit with great task lighting) that open up to impeccable storage and your every whim from a glass door mini bar to all the most important amenities.Sharp television replaces the former Bang AND Olfusen television that were confusing because the B&O remotes were never meant to work with hotel systems.I am not a fan of Sharp it is a lower quality television compared to LGs,Sonys and other brands. The upside is they are on beautiful round silver bases opposite the bed and the sliding glass doors They are adequate but the picture is not as sharp and bright had they used a more appropriate higher end brand.A beautiful fruit bowl and bottled water (with my brand of choice awaited) House chocolates appeared in my room the next day as well (this may or may not be typical) THE Good & the Bad The Beds as noted previously are platform they are very firm and have no box spring.The bed has zero movement. For firm mattress lovers you will be in heaven for those accustomed to the Westin Heavenly Beds you may be in much misery. The other thing that does happen through the night is the occasional blast of cruise ship horns which I also experienced at 3 AM Light sleepers may be startled in the otherwise quiet of night. Lighting A mix of state of the art LED energy efficient lighting with on off touch controls that are difficult and confusing to control in a darkened room at night. The lighting is stunning and well thought out when fully lit. I regret they didnâ€™t simply use dimmers for greater control of lighting and ease of function Power Converters are something the Park Hyatt Sydney truly got right located on both sides of the bed and desk/table area. Easy to access. Shades Like Andaz they use motorized shades one for black out and one for blocking some of the day time glare .They are not the high end of motorized shades and slightly noisy but highly effective,functional & attractive at doing their job. The heating and ac controls are adequate and a huge improvement over many I have observed elsewhere Bath Area The rainforest shower and second hand held is very nice with controls located on the marble at waist length that extends from the vanity into the shower area. I was slightly disappointed with the shower water pressure after coming from the Westin.The vanity area is very attractive with the toilet area located away from the bathroom in the front of the guest room in what almost seems like a second guest toilet at first glance. In the middle of the night confused how to get adequate lighting in the pitch black I ended up walking into the shower accidently seeking the toilet :) The Toto toilet is quiet elaborate one part heated seat one part bidet. Itâ€™s the fattest toilet seat Iâ€™ve ever parked myself on. Though I assume that many find it appealing to have their rears warmed while on the throne I am not a fan. I chose to pull the plug out of the wall rather than read the ownerâ€™s manual or call the butler to learn how to make it all work J I loved the new sleek glass minimalist European scales I will be purchasing one for myself Toiletries I am not a fan of their new shampoo amenity which is the new Bergamonte 222.Of course like beds subjective. Oddly there are tubs in the room and no Jacuzzis in the rooms and that follows the same path up to the expensive lavish suites that go for 3000 plus dollars a night. IMHO I believe that and the platform beds and the lack of Jacuzzis are the two biggest mistakes this otherwise amazing hotel flubbed. That of course will ultimately rely in the eyes of the beholder! The Dining Experience was below quality expectations though the team was welcoming and hospitable and always coming up with unexpected surprises during my stay They even know what brand beverage I prefer and had it available during my stay The Bellmen First Class & Professional The Concierge I didnâ€™t use but their services they never failed to smile and engage in nice conversation when accessing elevators where they are now located in the former space of the checkout desk area The Gym Has a new Techno Gym line up.I wish Hyatt had kept its recent smart partnership choice of Life Fitness.To be fair Techno Gym equip has made some improvements in recent years. However it is still not as good as Life Fitness,Nautilus and other fitness brands IMO The Spa Nicely redone with couple massage tables side by side so partners and or friends can be massaged together by two therapists at a time Final Assessment Park Hyatt Sydney after many years is well on its way to finding its ultimate promise to truly exceed most guest expectations. It was well on course even at the time of its closing last year despite its aging interior and small shortcomings. Today itâ€™s simply a vastly improved and much better hotel experience physically and aesthetically. It knows who its luxury customers are overall and what it takes to satisfy their most individual personal whims and desires for those that wish to engage in such pampering In my eyes it is what the Park Hyatt brand aspired to be at inception of the original brand launching and reasonably acheived. Park Hyatt Sydney is clearly well on its way taking it to the next level if early experiences are any indicator. Is the Park Hyatt Sydney worth its starting price of 800 dollars a night and up even in an overpriced high demand market like Sydney? Itâ€™s of my opinion that the Park Hyatt Sydney has few peers when it comes to overall guest service for those wishing to fulfil a truly aspirational experience in Sydney Surrounded by polished seasoned Hyatt hospitality professionals with amongst some of the best moments of my thirty years on the road in any brand. One can find a far more comfortable bed in Sydney and better overall dining experiences with far better value. However nothing compares to the remarkable team that remain currently on board or the magical setting that is a must for anyone traveling to Sydney for the first or the 100th time This is a place where celebrities, VIPs and the mere frequent traveller elite or not can feel pampered and made to feel like a true visiting VIP dignitary on revenue or award. I would suggest run donâ€™t walk and make a booking to get your preferred dates while availability exists Come experience one of the worlds most civilized unique aspirational experiences in hospitality surrounded by panoramic views of the Opera House In closing I wanted to award 5 stars for the team/service however I deducted one star for food quality and the platform bed.Shy of those two exceptions this remains one of my personal favorite properties in the word where one feels honored to be a guest Welcome back "Park Hyatt Sydney" nice to have you back!

Reviews.Title: “Flat Packed Gone Posh”
Reviews.Author: HarryP72
Reviews.Content: Location wise, this hotel has it all. Having just re-opened in Feb 2012, following a very expensive refit, I have to say we were sadly rather disappointed. Perhaps we expected more. After all, at a cost close to $1000 per night, one kind of expects something really good. We requested a room with an Opera House view, which we got; as long as you sat on top of the dining table and leant into the wall. It was as though the room itself wasn't actually designed with the view in mind. We asked to change room, and we were offered a similar room further around the corridor. The room had a reverse layout, so in theory we would get the 'killer viewâ€™ from the bed and couch, unfortunately not. Because of the rooms position within this wonderfully curvaceous building, the view could only be enjoyed if one were to also sit on (not at) the table. Had each of the rooms been fitted out in reverse format, one would have enjoyed the view from the bed and the settee...... clearly a rather large oversight by the interior designer. This is what happens when you design on paper and don't consider the aspect. Doh! In general the interior design is very heavy. Dark wooden veneerâ€™s on every surface, slightly oppressive and not really very â€˜Sydneyâ€™. The same finish in a London hotel may work, but not in a warm climate with bright skies and killer views. A prime example of this in the public spaces is the hotel bar. Dark and dingy, with views a stone throw away, yet you are concealed into a space behind screens and you canâ€™t even see the harbour let alone the Opera House. The breakfast room is nice and airy I have to say; very lovely to have breakfast in. Shame breakfast isnâ€™t included in the room rate; at $1000 is it unreasonable to expect this? The roof terrace is the best bit. Nice sun loungers and a cracking view. Perhaps a tad noisy, but given its location (under the bridge) one doesnâ€™t visit for peace and quiet. The staff were very polite and did a good job from a service point of view, however they donâ€™t have that edge that you would expect from a hotel of this standard. You donâ€™t get that feeling of sincerity, but perhaps that was also because they were new given the hotel had only been re-opened less than a month before our arrival. So, I am only giving 3 out of 5 because in my view the interior design is not great nor is it unique. It most certainly does not embrace that wonderful feeling in Sydney where the outdoors comes in and the inside goes out. It truly is a missed opportunity. I hate to say it, but it actually looks a little bit â€˜flat packedâ€™ gone posh. Oh, and the staff lack sincerity too.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Has Really Changed & Mixed Renovations”
Reviews.Author: LoyaltyLobby
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for the Friday night (16th of March). I was also supposed to stay for a Sunday, but decided to cancel my stay and to stay somewhere else in Sydney. The hotel is having the official grand reopening this Tuesday (20th of March, 2012). This hotel just feels very touristy due to its location in the rocks. It is perfect if it is your first time in Sydney and you care about the view of the Sydney Opera House. The view is not that important for me. I care more about functional hotel and the benefits they offer me as a Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond member. Per terms and conditions of the program I was eligible for the best available room. At the Park Hyatt Sydney this would have been Opera or City King Deluxe that they were selling at the time of check in. I checked this from Hyatt.com. Hotel did acknowledge that they do have at least City King Deluxe available, but would not upgrade me into it. I was too tired at this point to contact the Hyatt Consumer Affairs in the States to have them to fix the issue. This particular location has been playing this same game even before the renovations. The room that I had felt about the same as before. These are not huge by any means. I would have preferred somewhat smaller bathroom and more space in the room itself that now feels somewhat cramped. There is a large kitchen table that you should use as a work desk. If you work on the desk, it is impossible to use any of the two phones that you have in the room, however. The minibar setup is one of the best that I have seen at any hotel. The bed was very comfortable. I did, however, have a huge problem with the lights. They should have an instructional booklet by the bed how to operate the system. I couldn't figure out how to dim the room completely. I loved the Diamond amenity of a bottle of red wine and a small fruit display. The fitness center had been completely refurbished and they had a new line of LifeFitness equipment that I like. The space is rather small, but I doubt that there are going to be more than one or two exercising at any given moment due to the clientele at this hotel. The pool is on the rooftop that has zero privacy due to the bridge and the walking bridge tours. Breakfast was really good, but didn't like the restaurant area. I would have preferred to have my breakfast in a quiet setting but the room was full. I don't like hotel calling me at 11:56AM to ask if I need help with my bags. If you want to know what time I would be checking out (4PM) just ask. I also received a Thank You For Your Stay-email from the hotel before I had left. Attention to detail missing? There was already huge stains on the hallway outside of my room. Not sure if they had some trouble with water leaks?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt for 4 nights two weeks ago. This hotel spoiled all subsequent Australian hotels for us. None of them came close to the Hyatt. Everything was perfect. The room was beautiful, the view was fantastic, best location, wonderful sheets and towels, superb service.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Jaybee1972
Reviews.Content: Although the views are good - that's only half the story. The newly renovated rooms are clean, modern and very comfortable. Everything is thought of, including a PowerPoint next to your bed to charge you mobile phone. The shower and towles are amazing and the services is impeccable - I love this hotel and stay there when ever in sydeny - the rooms do feel a little smaller since the Reno but that's cause there is more inside the room. This is my favorite hotel in the world and I've been to hundreds

Reviews.Title: “complete disregard for clients”
Reviews.Author: travellady2531310
Reviews.Content: We had booked our trip completely around staying at the Park Hyatt in Sydney. One week before we were leaving, we were informed that the hotel was not ready. They stated they were surprised that the hotel would not be ready. When we were in Sydney, we walked over to the hotel, and there was scaffolding and major construction around. There was absolutely no way the management did not know way before we were notified that the hotel was not going to be ready. The manager complained about having to notify so many people about the delay. What a pity he had work to do while all the people with reservations had to scramble looking for another hotel! Absolutely disregard for the traveling public.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt Sydney - Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mel_emerald
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Park Hyatt Sydney on the night we were married. I wish it had have been for longer. The recent renovations have left nothing to spare with sleek modern furnishings and all the 'mod-cons' you could ask for. The black out blinds were a nice touch and the view just wonderful to wake up to in the morning. The service is exactly what what you would expect - of a very high standard. Of course, you can't get a much better location in Sydney. If you are in the financial position to be able to afford to stay there for a longer period of time, I couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: Following an extensive refurbishment the hotel reopened in February 2012. We stayed a week after the hotel had reopened having stayed here many times in the past. The whole experience is different from the way you are greeted and checked in personally in your room to the way that every member of staff goes out of their way to make your stay memorable. The rooms have been finished to a very high standard and every home comfort is provided and if you need anything you just contact the Butler Team who will make it happen. The Park Hyatt has raised the stakes in Sydney but I have to say it is not a cheap place to stay but if you want to spoil yourself then stay here. I have seen some negative comments about the beds but I slept perfectly and I thought that it was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful post-renovation.”
Reviews.Author: scruffybags
Reviews.Content: The hotel had not long re-opened when we stayed and is looking beautiful post-renovation with top notch updated facilities. Service levels are very high, and include a butler who looks after you during your stay. There were a few teething problems during our stay as can be expected at a newly opened hotel, but the managers took any issues we had very seriously and were outstanding in there approach to rectifying these. With staff like this the hotel will go on to become one of the best in the world. Easily the best service we had in Australia. There is a lovely heated roof-top pool, although this was not open during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “All New Look - Same "Crack Outfit" Running Front Of House”
Reviews.Author: RelaxWithMax
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to this icon of Australian 5 star hotels for many years. If you want the best 5 star hotel experience in Sydney bar none then this is the place for you. Prior to the recently completed renovation, the Park Hyatt Sydney already boasted the best rooms and everything else in town, so the wife and i were interested to see just how the 2011 renovations would raise the bar on an already exceptionally high benchmark. We checked in for 3 nights with a small group on March 9th 2012, just 3 weeks after the hotel was reopened on February 17th. On arrival,we were greeted by a youthful,enthusiastic, multilingual international front of house team, that could mix it with the best anywhere, anytime, anyplace in the world. - They are just "Shiny" ! - After 3 days we could see that they were still the highly skilled, well drilled machine that they were prior to the renovation. - Leon, the General Manager prior to the renovations, has returned with a vengance to re establish a new benchmark for Sydney 5 star properties. So, on to the rooms. - We stayed in an Opera King this time, which is smaller then the Opera Deluxe that we normally like to stay in. Japanese visitors will be delighted to know that the latest model Toto toilets have been installed in all rooms, complete with features that NASA engineers would be proud of. IT savvy android compatable devices have been added as well as a complete suite of IT outlets for all things IT. The bathroom features a nice bath and rainforest shower, which is a lovely addition. The beds are delightful and sooooooo comfy. - Better than most 5 stars we have stayed in. Our room came standard with a balcony overlooking the harbour and the Opera house and it was quite spacious with plenty of room for 2 on the comfy chairs provided. Room service was on time and most importantly hot !! Plates are pre heated and remain warm when themeals are served. Breakfast arrived complete with toaster which was set up on our table so that we could have hot toast with our meal cooked to our liking. The room decor is beige/brown predominately and the feel is very warm. - We also suggested that the 40' TV could be mounted a little higher so that it was easier to see from the bed when lying down. A completely new spa has been created replacing the old 3 room one with a new 5 room one and this time with a couples suite which we enjoyed. Treatements here are very good and if you like deep tissue massages done deep then this is one of the few hotels i have found that actually do this consistenetly. The Spa is now conveniently located next to the elevators on the second floor instead of having to access from the 4th floor down a staircase. - Much better ! The swimming pool is an outdoor facility and it is located on the 4th floor. It overlooks Sydney Harbour and the Opera house and it is a great place to soak up some rays and take in views of Sydney harbour at the same time. Service in the restaurant is schmick !! - We were served by staff from France, Norway, Germany and Italy. - a very youthful, professional team all smartly attired and groomed to the max. During the renovations last year the wife and i tried the Shangri La, The Intercontinental, The Sheraton and The four Seasons. - Whilst these are good, they are not even in the same solar system as the Park Hyatt. All now look very tired compared to the newly rolled out Park Hyatt, none can offer the on the Harbour experience and the Park Hyatt front of house team have an edge on all of them. - If you are planning a special trip to Sydney for whatever reason, don't even think about staying anywhere else. Having said that, you have to be prepared to go all the way and book a Harbour view room or a suite, as this is an important part of the wow factor of the hotel. From your balcony you are spitting distance from the Harbour in one of these and this is something you will enjoy and remember long after you leave. - Wife and i have spent many days and nights on the balcony sipping Champagne,listening to nice music and watching the world go by on the harbour. - Game over other Sydney 5 stars !! Park Hyatt Sydney, is not for those of you who prefer to do things on a budget. My view is that money is only worth the pleasure it brings you and you will get plenty of that staying here. On check out, Leon the GM met us and enquired about our stay to ensure we were happy. This was a nice touch and further demonstrated the levels of service you experience here. Left with the wifey, once again very happy that our favourite 5 star retreat in Sydney was back open for business. - Arguably the best hotel experience anywhere in Australia. - Now its back open, "piggy banks" all over the world will be sweating !

Reviews.Title: “See Sydney at its best”
Reviews.Author: grussellt
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in 2010 (so I'm a little late writing this review) but the hotel was superb even before the recently completed refurbishment. We enjoyed two nights (gained in a promotion) and enjoyed beautiful views across Circular Quay to the Opera House. As a Sydney resident I hadn't previously stayed in this Hyatt but it must be up there with the best in the World. Service was excellent - and lunch in the restaurant, with the best views of Sydney Harbour, should be considered by all visitors to Sydney. Lunch in the bar enjoys similar views with good food at affordable prices. It's expensive - but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury”
Reviews.Author: RKS
Reviews.Content: The recently refurbished Park Hyatt Sydney is simply amazing! From the moment we arrived to checkout, the level & quality of service was just incredible. The room furnishing are high grade and the bathroom is over the top! This upgrade will raise the bar for the competing luxury hotels in Sydney. I especially liked the use of a dining table in the room in lieu of a traditional desk. We enjoyed a very good dinner in our room looking out over the harbor. The breakfast buffet does not offer as many choices as I would have expected at this price range, but the quality is high. I absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: cucuruchito
Reviews.Content: If you can stay wherever you want in Sydney this is the best location ever. I ve heard there have been refurbishments so check as many aereas must have improved!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: JacquesA
Reviews.Content: We had this 2 night stay offered to us. I don't know what it cost, but whatever it did, boy was it worth it! Amazing. Excellent location, right in the middle of everything. Service as one would expect it. Although we stayed in a City Harbour room, and we would have loved one looking at the Opera House, we had nothing wrong to say about the room. Reception staff courteous (could smile a bit more!) and efficient. Concierge was great with advice on restaurants around the area. Now, in the words of the song: "if I was a rich man", I would be staying here more often!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HYATT I've ever stayed at...try the Westin instead.”
Reviews.Author: dbrownBeijing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Park Hyatt Sydney last year and we had a terrible experience. The service was horrible and the room and amenities were dirty and poorly maintained. For 700 USD/night I expected much better service and a much cleaner room. The room was covered in dust, the hair dryer was old, dirty and clogged with grime, and the shower was clogged with muck and flooded. Hotel staff did not refill shampoo or shower gel and gave us a hard time when we ask for them to follow up. The Park Hyatt Sydney was so bad that my wife and I moved out and into the Westin where we had none of the problems we encountered at the Hyatt and paid significantly less. I sent a letter to Park Hyatt telling them about my experience. They sent me a letter asking me to go back, spend another 700 USD and "give them another chance". Sorry Park Hyatt, for 700 USD you should have got it right the first time.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions - Poor”
Reviews.Author: marvs000
Reviews.Content: [Whilst my personal experience may not reflect the hotel greatly, please bear in mind that should the day have been seamless as it could potentially be, this hotel could be the best place Iâ€™ve stayed within Sydney] This hotel was booked on behalf of my uncle due to the fact that he wanted to surprise me for my birthday and give me a hotel room that I couldâ€™ve shared with my partner. The manner in which he called the reservations desk, he was able to secure a room and have everything pre-paid in advance and since he was affiliated with a loyalty programme of the Hyatt hotel chain, his details were stored in the system. The most important thing to note was that he noted my name down on the reservation. On the day of arrival, I had arrived with my partner and was expecting to have a seamless check in upon verification of my identity and that my uncle had given permission; unfortunately this was not the case. Because reservations hadnâ€™t put my name down as repeatedly requested, I had to wait outside the lobby (apparently the lobby is for â€˜genuineâ€™ guests and I was asked to leave) for an hour or so whilst my uncle travelled from one side of Sydney to the other in order to finally check us in. After a lengthy wait, we were finally in the room and the amnesties were astonishing. The marble floor bathrooms were impressive and the room itself, though small, was adequate enough for our needs. However, we did ask for a Double/King bed and instead, we were allocated to a two twin beds. We went back to the front desk and because of the peak season, they were unable to adhere to the request. We wanted to enjoy the swimming facilities but because we checked in late and apparently there wasnâ€™t sufficient staffs, the pool was subsequently closed so that is another facility that were unable to enjoy. Whilst the location was superb, we were allocated in a room that the balcony overlooked underneath the Harbour Bridge. I guess we did ask for a Harbour Bridge view. Service upon check in, whilst was out of our control, was unsatisfactory especially when they did request for me to leave the lobby whilst I waited for my uncle â€¦ in the rain! First impressions unfortunately do last and I left this hotel with great disappointment as to my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Bianca S
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and fantastic position, a little expensive but overall ... no complaints, please try it ... you wont be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Anxious to see renovations”
Reviews.Author: Prepwade
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of the Park Hyatt Sydney. It is in the heart of everything Sydney. We flew into Sydney from the US and stayed at another hotel for a couple days then explored the rest of Australia. Once we saw the Park Hyatt sitting under the bridge we agreed we needed to stay there on our last night in Australia, so the last night we stayed here and were not disappointed at all. The service was great, the location and views were wonderful. It definitely needed a renovation but was still very clean (They were closing later in the month to do a full reno). I am excited to go back and even though the price is way higher than anywhere else in town I would stay here again. It's worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous view”
Reviews.Author: Ella F
Reviews.Content: I walked into my room to see a backdrop of the Sydney Opera House--it was stunning. I have ot admit it was hard to leave my room as I just wanted to sit on my balcony and watch the boats pass by in front of the opera house. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The staff was excellent. I don't care for first floor rooms--the first room I was assigned opened out onto a very nice courtyard, but ultimately I asked to be moved to something on a higher floor. They accomodated my request immediately. Food was alright and location is a little removed from the heart of downtown, but still easily walkable (Circular Quay is right there).

Reviews.Title: “What a Country”
Reviews.Author: valhalla13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2003 to watch India and then again in 2004 to watch Pakistan at the SCG. Great hotel with views over the harbour and bridge. Make sure you pay an extra for the sea views, as we had a load of Aussies that came to visit for a very long party! Advance Australia fair.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly quiet inside”
Reviews.Author: Travel_0084
Reviews.Content: We spent part of our honeymoon here back in nov 2010 and I was amazed at how well insulated the rooms were from the hustle and bustle of activity outside. A bottle of sparkling wine chilling on ice was a nice touch and appreciated. The bathroom was beautiful with marble everywhere, with a separate bath and shower which could easily accommodate two people. Finally, we had the breakfast which was superb, and I would highly recommend you order off the menu as well as partake in the breakfast buffet laid out for you.

Reviews.Title: “A superlative experience”
Reviews.Author: al29252
Reviews.Content: Excellent service beyond the call of duty, I've rarely experienced anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: osborncats
Reviews.Content: Staff facilities room location absolutely the greatest for my wife and I. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Chizinha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a room on the first floor. Massive varanda, overlooking the Opera House. The bedroom is massive, you can hear the TV from the bathroom, and the hotel reception is simply the best: the gild that did my check-in actually took me straight into my bedroom! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Smiller11
Reviews.Content: This was probably the most expensive night of our honeymoon but my goodness it was worth it. Our package included champagne, breakfast and a dessert plate. We arrived in Sydney after a pretty bad and sleepless flight and took a cab straight to the hotel at about 6am. I could have kissed the receptionist when he said that our room was ready for us as I was exhausted. The room was spectacular with large marble bathroom and walk in wardrobe but the star was the view; our room looked directly across the harbour to the Opera House. It was absolutely stunning. As we were on our honeymoon the hotel had kindly given us a bottle of champagne and some strawberries to celebrate so with the package we already had we actually had two bottles of champagne. After a quick sleep we went to the hotel restaurant for a delicious breakfast with the view over the harbour. Weâ€™d definitely have breakfast there again even if not staying at the hotel. We decided to have dinner on our balcony that night as we thought we wouldnâ€™t find a restaurant with a better view. Room service was very nice and we also had our dessert plate and some champagne. The next morning we went for a swim in the pool on the roof which was lovely; itâ€™s just below the bridge so there was another great view. The hotel also benefits from a business centre with free internet for the first 30 (I think) minutes so that was enough to send a few emails. The hotel is right on the quayside and an easy walk to the train station even with baggage so Iâ€™d get that to and from the airport. If I had the money Iâ€™d definitely stay here again. It was sublime.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: KylieandAaron
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the night of our wedding. Apon arrival we had been upgraded to a bigger room with views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge with champagne awaiting in our room. The staff were lovely, the views were great and our room was huge. It really was special and we appreciate the hotel staff for upgrading our room without us even asking :)

Reviews.Title: “UGLIEST HOTEL INTERIORS”
Reviews.Author: Mandols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for two nights as a guest with friends and we had the worst experience. This is supposed to be a luxury hotel. Thus has nothing to do with luxury and should be a 3 star hotel in the western suburbs. It dies not deserve the location it is in. The rooms are dark and out dated. The breakfast room offers nice views but the actual food is nothing special. The only good thing about thus hotel is the location but I can think of many other hotels with great location and a better view off all of Sydney such as the Intercontinental. I'm really disappointed by this hotel and it really was my worst ever hotel experience the rooms are depressing and I would never wish upon anyone to stay there because it would be a nightmare to go through something like that again.

Reviews.Title: “Just WONDERFUL, Best ever”
Reviews.Author: BestQuality
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt never disappoints, and this one in Sydney? Just amazing. The location is the best you can get in Sydeny, right next to the bridge and the Opera. The rooms, the restaurant, the brakfast (!), the staff, just WOW. Expensive, but worth it. Go there, and plan anything at the Parl Hyatt: a wedding, a cocktail party a banquet, AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night Bliss”
Reviews.Author: NTDSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding night here and it was gobsmacking! The rooms are so funky yet classy and very modern with leather chairs and bed. The marble bathroom was larger then my bathroom at home, heaps of room and very glamorous. Spectacular views of the harbour and Opera House. Double glass sliding doors that block out any noise. The kitchen in the morning cooks up a storm with ANYTHING you order-I asked for an organic omelette with no oil and they and it and it tasted delicious. The only down side was we had such a short stay there we arrived at 10pm and left at 8am.. Still dying to get back and experience it in full and not be in a hurry this time. Highly recommend, yes its very pricey but your worth it and will rave about it for years afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location but needs better service quality and renovation”
Reviews.Author: LuneLune
Reviews.Content: During my stay (winter) the swimming pool was not accessible and the bars were closed around 10pm which is very early for a Park Hyatt located in a country's capital. The location is just superb at night but a bit far from everything so you definitely need a taxi wherever you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: LZSR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a romantic weekend at the Park Hyatt after snapping up a advertised deal. We had a beautiful opera view room. It was big and spacious, with a bigger than average king size bed and a beautiful marble bathroom. The view of the harbour and the opera house was gorgeous! Breakfast was included in our deal and was probably the only disappointment - the choices were limited and food was prepared in a hurry to keep up with the demand. Otherwise we couldn't fault anything. We received a bottle of bubbles & strawberries on arrival and the concierge got us into a booked out restaurant. We also had a $100 voucher to use within the hotel which was spent in the bar on a fantastic burger and a few glasses of wine. I loved it and am hoping to get taken back there soon! The atmosphere down there is just magical.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: oscarfelix
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical as to whether it would be worth the money but I have to say between the fantastic views (opera view suite), great location, and superb concierge I am now sure it was. The staff was so friendly, when we came in from our international flight early in the morning they let us use the spa facilities to clean up so we could enjoy the day instead of waiting around for our room. The greatest thing, though, was the concierge. We booked several dinner reservations through the concierge including one reservation that I was told was "unavailable" by the restaurant. I think what sets apart a luxury hotel is the service and they didn't let us down. The rooms are slightly dated, but the hotel is now closed for a six-month renovation, so any defects (I thought the room was nice but it did have a 90s style bathroom) should be cured. We enjoyed the restaurant, but we did only eat there for breakfast and one lunch - as I recall now we had a really nice waffle one breakfast (so many places can't do them right or manage to serve them hot) and a fantastic burrata appetizer at lunch. I also used the spa for a massage and the masseuse was good (I had a deep tissue and you need to get someone who knows what they're doing for that) and the massage room was beautiful. Over our four day stay we really had no complaints - ok one, they need to stop charging for internet access it is just ridiculous at their price level- and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs renovation.”
Reviews.Author: thrPRICESareRIGHT
Reviews.Content: To begin...we were extremely excited to be staying at another Park Hyatt. We had stayed in the Park Hyatt in Melbourne a few weeks before and LOVED it! Unfortunately the chain is not consistent. This hotel is one of the most expensive hotels in Sydney. It's location cannot be beat. It has a great reputation, but lacked in most areas. The room was old and worn. We had a room with the view of the opera house and that was AMAZING. It's fitness/spa center is tiny and the pool area lacked any amenities. We had spa services. There was only 2 massage rooms, a sauna and a steam room which is used by everyone in the hotel. There was no "relaxation room" so we decided to use the jacuzzi prior to getting our treatment. The treatments were, standard, and the ladies were sweet, but it was nothing to write home about. The hotel staff, in general, was snooty and did not seem to want to be bothered. We are used to this attitude in the USA, but after we had been in Australia for a month we were more than disappointed in their hospitality. Because this is an extremely expensive hotel and one of the highest rated I would have expected much more. Maybe they can learn a thing or two from their sister property in Melbourne. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - restaurant not good”
Reviews.Author: gaby_pa
Reviews.Content: We cashed Hyatt Passport Points to stay at Sydney Park Hyatt. What a big different from Y Hotel Hyde Park! (Read my previous review of Y Hotel Hyde Park). The hotel is about 10 minute walk to Circular Quay. We did not get the Opera room, but our room faced Circular Quay and International Cruise Terminal. I was told that to use the Wi-Fi, I had to log on with my last name and room number as password. When I opened a browser, the log on screen was automatically populated with first name and last name of the guest who stayed in different room. For privacy reason, it wasnâ€™t good. I explained the system issue to the front desk. Internet is free for Hyatt Platinum members. One day the front desk helped me to mail several postcards free of charge but the next day other staff asked me â€œwould you like to pay $2.10 for the postcard stamps or bill to the room?â€� The heat wave caused the temperature to jump to 42 C. It was the perfect time to try the roof-top pool. I notice a popular restaurant â€œPancake on the Rocksâ€�, just 5 minute walk. We did not eat there because the line was too long. We decided to dine at Hyatt Harbor Kitchen. We ordered McLeay Valley rabbit braised in balsamic with fregola, marjoram, pecorino and Tasmanian wilderness beef short rib with tamarind, molasses glaze, watercress, horseradish. The sauce was so overwhelming that I could not taste the meat at all. The food was unappealing (see photos) and looked like what Fiona serves Shrek every morning. Overall, the hotel and restaurant service were excellent but food is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views,professional staff,we wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: lbkgooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the park hyatt for five days in jan 2011 and have to say,everything about this hotel is first class.Situated in the rocks area our view from the room was of the sydney opera house and harbour.The bar was a very relaxed affair with excellent staff as was the breakfast restaurant which had the added bonus of floor to ceiling glass windows allowing views of the bridge,harbour and opera house.Concierge were probably the best concierge i have ever dealt with,providing us with ashes tickets,restaurant reservations and driving out to a poorly managed hotel in the hunter valley to pick up some items i had left there and posted them onto our next port of call,even though we had left the park hyatt four days prior(a big thankyou to bruce and grant btw).We would never stay anywhere else in Sydney.One other thing, the hotel is closing for a refurb in march , so should be even better when it re-opens

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, professional friendly staff, pampers the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Light_33
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Sydney on business - the business day would start at 10a and we would go thru to 5p eating lunch at the conference table. Coming home to this hotel was such a breath of fresh air - literally there are floor to ceiling retractable windows looking out onto the spectacular view of Sydney harbor and the opera house. the air was caressing, wonderful help in the bar so courteous and friendly. the restaurant was where I ate most of my meals and was really good. (everything tastes better in australia) the room had a balcony looking straight into the opera house, fabulous bath tub, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you even consider another place to stay?”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardWisdom
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Sydney by any measure. Fantastic location, great staff, excellent rooms. I stayed one night in the Four Seasons just a few blocks away, and it's good too, but I'd go back to Park Hyatt without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous staff make a great hotel in an iconic setting pure perfection”
Reviews.Author: montySydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Sydney on the edge of Sydney Harbour has point blank views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and Circular Quay. All rooms have a view of the water because the hotel follows the curve of the harbour and overlooks Circular Quay. The service is flawless, the staff charming and the rooms without fault. The restaurants are excellent and the city and historic Rocks area is on the doorstep. This is a great hotel that makes you feel welcome and special.

Reviews.Title: “Well done, as always”
Reviews.Author: ALKDVS
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the best in Sydney for location and service. (We have stayed here before, both times on points.) The restaurant is excellent, the service is excellent, the hotel staff is friendly and efficient; nothing was too much trouble. About the only faults one can find with the hotel is that the rooms are rather small for the price--and the rooftop pool is a joke. The rooms have been refurbished and are quite comfortable, making up for their size. But the pool is tiny and when it is colonized by children, as it was when we were there, there weren't even enough deck chairs for everyone who wanted to be on the pool deck to sit. People were pretty unhappy with the situation. But you simply cannot beat the city/harbor/opera view that the rooms have. One of our favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajmia111
Reviews.Content: All aspects of the Park Hyatt Sydney were first rate. The location (Rocks district, directly across from the Opera House, nearly underneath the Sydney Harbour Bridge, adjacent to circular quay) is unrivaled; the room (deluxe opera king) beautiful, spacious, smartly designed, with an amazing view; the personnel - professional, attentive, responsive; concierge solved problems (broken blackberry repair as an example) with incredible efficiency and care. This is a top notch hotel in a perfect location with a terrific staff. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: lovelongboatkey
Reviews.Content: We arrived by night in Sydney, check-in was a casual, relaxed affair and we were shown to our room and were wowed by the amazing view across the harbour to The Sydney Opera House. The hotel is perfectly situated at The Rocks in Circular Quay. The room was spacious and comfortable, but a little dated. The hotel is closing for a six-month refit at the end of March, so I would say it will be spectacular when it reopens, as all of the common areas were very nice. We had a drink and some bar food, in the old fashioned bar which was a lovely spot to unwind from the days travelling. Breakfast was wonderful, overlooking the Opera House, Bridge and Harbour. The rooftop pool and patio were a little small, but a pleasant place to chill. The hotel staff were really first-class, they could not do enough for us. The concierge arranged some brilliant, inexpensive tickets to the Ashes for us, a great day. Julien was very attentive waiting on us for breakfast. And Grant was amazing, above and beyond, to reinstate us with left items. Would definately return, I am sure it will be amazing after the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “What a Place!!”
Reviews.Author: gmcCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Located at "The Rocks" tehe Park Hyatt Sydney offer a really clean and sophisticated atmosphere. Also, the most unbeleivable view of the Harbor and teh Sydney Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Simple incredible - but bring your cheque book”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in an Opera Deluxe room. What a view! This hotel is simply incredible,;the service, the location, the view, the rooms. The only fault I can think of, is my room was not far from a very noisy outside bar, which didn't quieten until midnight on the Friday night. Not particularly pleasant. However, at over $1,000 per night, it's not exactly a budget option!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: Another reviewer wrote that they experienced unpretentious, 5 star service and that is a perfect description of what you can expect. We used a Stay Coupon for a couple of nights and were given a standard room looking at the Circular quay but not the opera house. When we arrived, our room was not ready and I was unfortunately suffering from a migraine. The front desk arranged a day room and sent in some tea and a hot pack to me. We came back from dinner later that night and found our AC was not working. The night manager quickly moved us to another room for the night, apologizing profusely and offering us breakfast or anything else we desired. The next morning, without any mention from us, the staff offered us either a larger room with the same view we had or a standard size room with a view of the Opera House. They couldn't have been more solicitous and we were appreciative. The breakfast is excellent, but pricey (45 per person). The location is the best in Sydney. It is walking distance from the ferries (to zoo or beaches), the Opera House, Botanical Gardens and next to the Sydney Bridge. You can walk anywhere and there is a free bus at the Circular Quay downtown. Standard rooms are quite large and nicely appointed. If you want an Opera House view, make sure you book it. What made it special was sitting out on the balcony at daybreak or evening and looking out at the scenery. There are two types of balconies...one is more like a french balcony and one can support a couple of chairs and a table. If you plan to use your balcony, make sure you request the larger balcony style. No room has a poor view, so if you are traveling with a family, you may want to get a larger room. There is a roof top pool and you can walk to all sorts of restaurants. For cruisers, it is next to the cruise terminal. The Hyatt will drive you and your luggage there. We were very pleased with our stay. Sydney is a lovely city and the Park Hyatt doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great room, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: cyclinglover
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night; Couldn't fault anything. The location and views are the best in Sydney. The room and service was great, breakfast was good but not outstanding. What I really liked was that the hotel was really quiet, which is an important issue for me. Conclusion: this is a really great hotel, but it is too expensive, especially considering the expensive Australian dollar (at today's exchange rates). FYI, there will be a big renovation in 2011, and the rooms should be even better after it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. First class service.”
Reviews.Author: Maisondememe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a superb four night stay at the Park Hyatt, Sydney. The location is perfect and service top quality without being intrusive. We stayed in room 344 which had the benefit of direct views of the Opera House. Dinner in the hotel restaurant is highly recommended. One very minor grumble was the need to queue up to put your bread in the toaster at breakfast â€“ although you could order it from the menu at extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sparkleytraveler
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed overnight at the hotel but I have been to the hotel for High Tea with my cousin. Wow. The most impressive, most stunning views of Sydney Harbour one could imagine. Just incredible! The service was fantastic, the food was delicious. Afterwards we got a tour of the hotel and it was immaculate. If I didn't have family I could stay with, I would definitely stay here... The location makes it so wonderful - close to everything you want to be close to during a visit to Sydney, but it is also quite peaceful and sort of set apart from all the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's best location, with subtle style.”
Reviews.Author: Familytour4
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. It has a wonderful low key ambience and well trained, friendly staff make this 5 star hotel more memorable than most. This just adds to the extraordinary view over to the iconic Sydney Opera House and harbour. The rooms have been newly decorated, so are comfortably chic. The restaurant staff are attentive and the food challenges the palatte in a positive way. A special event deserves a special hotel, business or pleasure they will make your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth hotel of trip and finally a winner!”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: We've had a tough 2 weeks with three disappointing hotel stays. Arriving from our biggest disappointment at the Park Hyatt in Melbourne, our expectations were somewhat reduced. But, as soon as we pulled up to the entrance of the Sydney Park Hyatt, it was clear this was a whole different story. There was not one aspect of the service at this hotel that disappointed. Door men, valets, front desk clerks, restaurant service staff, concierge...all performed beyond expectations. We complained about the prices at the Melbourne Park Hyatt. In Sydney the prices were the same, but we did not feel taken advantage of. At the Sydney Park Hyatt, you pay for the quality, but the quality is worth paying for. The food quality is excellent, the location is outstanding for downtown visiting (though a bit tough to get to since it is the furthest point you can go through generally very slow traffic), many of Sydney's attractions are within walking distance as are the ferrys and many great restaurants. Take the ferry to Manly Beach and have lunch at the recently opened Manly Pavilion restaurant! It is a great experience...and, of course, don't miss the Opera House tour.

Reviews.Title: “it doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: gbramson
Reviews.Content: If going to Sydney, I can't imagine any better location in all of Australia! Beautiful rooms, hotel, restaurants, roof pool....and the view! The staff is almost too perfect! If there is room for a single complaint it's that the great view room we had is a long distance from the elevator, but it's WORTH the walk!!! Simply stated, all around outstanding! Would go again and book the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Neilmclean
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location and lovely rooms. As good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “A dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: julesandheath
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for our 8th Wedding Anniversary & My husband's 34th Birthday. Because two such special occasions were tied over the weekend, we decided this year to do something really special and I'm so happy we booked at the Park Hyatt, Sydney. Due to extreme excitement, the morning before we flew to Sydney (from Adelaide) I rang the hotel to enquire as to the view from our assigned room, and what room number we were. (also, a previous experience shows that late arrivals to some hotels you get "what's left"). This was not the case here. I spoke to Simone who was very helpful and entertained my enthusiasm and barage of questions. A good start... We arrived late, about 10pm and we had the pleasure of Ronny checking us in. Very professional and friendly and it was a really nice start to our stay. As it was a special stay Ronny arranged a bottle of wine to our room - this was a really nice thing to do for us, thank you. Next we decided to have a hot chocolate before retiring to our room. Thanks to my earlier liaison with Simone, Stuart brought out a dessert with a candle on it (me being the terrible wife, i hadn't arranged a cake:). Thank you Stuart, this was very special. Kirsten was looking after us also and she was such a delight as well. The hospitality and warmth we experience from Stuart & Kirsten made us immediately feel at home. It was the end of the night and yet they were very relaxed and had lovely smiles for us and we really enjoyed our interactions with them. Although I had an itinerary for our trip to Sydney, the next morning I rang concierge about a minor query. I was speaking to Chris who drew from me our plans for the day. By the time we went to Concierge 10 minutes later, Chris had a number of Manly breakfast dining options and ferry timetables for our day. Wow! We hadn't expected this and he had even highlighted certain details for us. During our stay calling Chris each morning became a regular for us. I feel he encapsulates the service you expect at this establishment and Chris does it with ease. I wish him all the best, he was really lovely to us. I highly recommend WOLFIES GRILL for dinner - I have dined here previously and it's still as excellent as I remember it and fyi it is on the waterfront. Best of all it is only a stones throw (literally) from the front door of the hotel - an easy stroll in heels ladies! We also dined at Aria while in town, which was a complete sham trading under a tv persons name. Hugely disappointing on so many levels (except the food which is a real shame for the chefs.) We were made to wait 60 minutes for our table which I had booked months in advance, they tried to then give us a middle of the room table when i had requested a window table in my booking, they tried to charge us $100 of the previous tables drinks, they filled still tap water into our sparkling water glass - of which we'd had half a glass each and were charged $24 for! the list goes on sadly. It was over $150pp and we were hugely dissatisfied with our experience and I feel really sorry for Matt Moran and the chefs because front of house really let them down (I have reviewed it so and wish i'd read previous reviews saying similar things *sigh*) Back to the Hyatt! (Wish we'd dined here instead of Aria). I would like to make a special mention to housekeeping. Our rooms were kept pristine clean and the turn down was lovely. I've been to hotels where you sense housekeeping do a rush job through your room but I got the feeling that housekeeping took great care and pride in their work because our rooms were always of a very high standard. We enjoyed a lovely warm spa one morning. The water level was a bit low but we still enjoyed ourselves. We noticed a very well equiped gym on site also. We ordered in room service one morning and it was delicious and i have to say, not too badly priced compared to some hotels we've been to (not that i'd want to pay anymore!) Room service was efficient and I was very impressed with this. We had room 005 which has a view to the left of the Opera House and across the water to the city. it was fabulous! thank you very much to the Hyatt for this room. Room 004 would also be ok but i think the rooms get even better up to around 009 / 010 or so with probably even more frontal views of the operal house. My sincere thank you goes out to the Hyatt and it's beautiful people. This was a very special 4 days for us in Sydney and we had been looking forward to it for quite a few months. Because it was a romantic holiday, where we stayed really mattered to us and you all did a wonderful job of helping us have a great stay. We are spoiled now, and we will only ever stay at the Hyatt now for future sojourns to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underserved”
Reviews.Author: luxurytravelguru
Reviews.Content: Second time at this property and I was unsure about staying after a very ordinary experience last time. Location aside (which nobody can argue is phenomenal), the service is not up to five star standards and more in line with a three or perhaps four star property. The room furnishings etc are showing wear and tear (our drapes filthy). Housekeeping was limited to making the beds and changing towels, but do not expect anything more, no tidying, removal of dirty glasses, no chocolates with turndown, nothing special. Expect to have to ask for everything in the restaurants, water etc, and your room service orders to be incorrect and the food cold. I understand the hotel is undergoing some refurbishing next year and I would recommend that they focus on beefing up their service standards which are bordering on appalling. Overall a very average, overrated and ridiculously overpriced experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, albeit pricy, hotel in a supurb location”
Reviews.Author: Sunny777
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of the Park Hyatt is superb. Stay here, and you'll be looking at the Opera House from your balcony. Not only that, but you'll be steps away from great restaurants and bars, shopping, and many of the city's major attractions. You'll have a wonderfully appointed room with everything just where it should be, a well-stocked minibar, and a comfortable bed. Venture to the roof and you'll find a pool area where you can order drinks and food from room service and relax. The concierge was helpful in showing us where to go and what to do. We made reservations at Aria for our last night in Sydney. When we sat down, the waiter brought over complimentary champagne since we had booked through the Park Hyatt, which was a really nice touch. Made me wish I had made all of my reservations through the hotel! The pool area is very pleasant. Unfortunately, the hot tub wasn't very warm - but everything else was nice. We didn't eat at the hotel, but the restaurant and bar areas looked nice, too. Overall, a very nice hotel with everything you need to be comfortable. As others have mentioned, it does feel a it more businessy than leisurely. I can't really put a finger on it - everyone was very cordial and pleasant, but it just didn't have that warm feeling that other hotels of this caliber I've stayed at have. But then again, it is a city hotel. As for the city itself - definitely a nice place. Very liveable, actually. We were there in mid-Sept., so the days were mostly warm and the nights cool. We did the Bridge Climb (steps from the hotel and a fun, if time-consuming, activity), the Opera House tour, a speedboat tour on the Harbour, Sydney Tower (avoid this one - it's a huge tourist trap), Darling Harbour (good nightlife and restaurants - we had dinner at the very nice Indian restaurant Zaafran), and the Zoo (quick ferry ride away). We skipped Bondi beach since the weather was a bit cool. Also recommended - Pancakes on the Rocks - a 24-hour pancake restaurant with numerous delicious choices. But here's the bottom line.
