Without a doubt, the Park Hyatt is definitely nice. Best hotel in Sydney? Probably. Would I stay here again? Sure. Would I pay full price? Probably not. While I haven't stayed elsewhere in the city, there are many nice hotels in the area with far more reasonable rates. Although the hotel and staff was pleasant in every way, the very fact that it's in the city and that there are many options to chose from would probably prevent me from paying what I feel are very high rates. That being said - if you're able to snag a discount of about 50%, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: global_nomad_pacific
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be Sydney best. I was really impressed by the level of service and the quality of the staff who went out of their way to be helpful. The location is fabulous and we found (with help of concierge) some great restaurants in walking distance of hotels. Breakfast is pretty good - but I think the buffet could be better (eg Park Hyatt Milan bfast better), but you can not beat the view from the breakfast room - it is priceless directly out to the harbour and opera house. Only downside is that I felt that the interior of the hotel is starting to look dated and tired and the rooms need to be refurbished, they are ok but just not top notch. We stayed for free due to Hyatt loyalty program. So great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's Best, Bar None”
Reviews.Author: LunaLondon
Reviews.Content: PH Sydney is a wonderful retreat, with an unbeatable location, jaw-dropping views, understated opulence and warm, easygoing but attentive service. Service is discreet and personal. The rooms are extremely comfortable and enjoy senstaional views, ours was of the full Opera House and Harbour. I could have sat in my Emes recliner all day, just looking at it. There was also a sizeable balcony, table and chairs from which to enjoy it too. For another great view - of the Harbour Bridge and the city skyline, there is a lovely rooftop small, which makes up in sheer style and views whatever it might lack in size. Breakfast, and yet again, the views, were sensational at the Harbour Kitchen. The fare itself was great, but the views and ambience made it unique and exquisite. I've stayed in a lot of good Sydney hotels (IC, FS, Westin, Sheraton, Hilton), but the Park Hyatt is in a class of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Keisie
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Everything was very luxurious. The staff went out of its way to help us. The staff helped me book my Sydney Bridgeclimb adventure and helped us get disabled accessible taxis for my mother. The room was wonderful. Outside your window is the Sydney Opera house and to your left is the Sydney harbor bridge. We would often eat breakfast or hang out in the balcony and just take in the sights. The rooms are very roomy and comfortable. The bathroom is large and luxurious. I love Hyatt's little toiletries and how they match these to the place. For instance, in Bankok all the soaps and shampoos were mint (because of the heat), in Sydney they were figs and olives (i think) and in London they were oat and barley based. Upon learning that we would be visiting London later this year, the staff actually printed out a brochure of the Hyatt Hotels in London. They were accommodating and very friendly. I love the Park Hyatt! It's a wonderful hotel, a little pricey, but it's a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “They simply went out of their way - extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: csaa1480
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days there in early September 2009 on the occasion of our wedding. The hotel - and in particular the staff - was amazing. Nothing was too much to ask for, they did everything they could to help us with the preparations and sort everything out (delivery of the cake, limousine, champagne, restaurant reservations, etc). In particular the concierge team truly deserves to be described as "simply the best". They seemed to share our excitement and during preparations checked regularly whether everything was fine. On the day, in addition to all the other logistics, they sorted out a separate room for my wife and her stylist to do the make-up, etc. I have never felt better cared for and looked after in a hotel. A true gem.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: WildeOrton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week holiday in Australia, during which we stayed at both the Park Hyatt in Sydney and Melbourne. We could not have been more satisfied with our stay at either location, but our Sydney stay was especially magical. I will say up front that I am a Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond member, so I received amenities that others may not (free breakfast, room upgrades, etc.) and was able to stay for free due to a Hyatt promotion. Obviously, any value oriented questions about our stay will be greatly distorted because we stayed, basically, for free, but that should not detract from the level of service and accommodation we received, nor the stunning views. We were a party of four and we had reserved two rooms, which they were able to get adjoining for us. Both modern rooms were exceptionally spacious, with huge, walk-in closets and enormous, marble bathrooms with separate tub and shower. Butler service is provided for every room and he was extremely gracious, bringing cookies, fruit and M&M's each day without our asking. The lighting was perfect and able to be dimmed throughout, and the drapes were linked to a remote control for opening and closing. Obviously, any guest staying at this hotel is going to request (insist?) on a room with an Opera House view, which cannot be accommodated in all cases. Ours were in between; they had a view of the structure from our balcony, if we stood to the right and looked out to our left. We could not see the Opera House from our beds, or anywhere inside the room, but the city views we had, in addition to the ability to see the Opera House, made it quite nice. We ate breakfast in the main restaurant every day and the food was wonderful, if expensive for paying guests. Almost all the tables look out to the Opera House and it a quite a lovely sight first thing in the morning. Ate at the Little Kitchen one evening and really enjoyed the food there, as well. Less expensive than the main restaurant and same high quality ingredients. All in all, we felt very pampered during out visit and we would not have changed a thing. One special "thank you" to the concierge with whom we had the most interaction, Junaidi Susantio. He could not have been more gracious and he made our stay that much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Travel-fanaticUK
Reviews.Content: In sum, an exceptional, understated but elegant hotel with excellent, professional staff, a superb concierge who can provide genuine recommendations for hot spots and places to go off the tourist trail. Rooms understated but beautiful, and incredible views across the harbourfront. Restaurant also excellent - breakfast couldnt be better and the dinner menu also superb. If you're looking for a highly-professional, sleek hotel outfit this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, luxurious room. Shame about the room service.”
Reviews.Author: warchild69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply stunning - easily the best location in Australia, with stunning views of one of the world's most beautiful harbours. Our checkin was handled with discrete, personalised service, and our room was ready upon arrival. The room itself was magnificent, and among the finest of all the Hyatt properties I have stayed in around the world. Unfortunately, the quality of room service was poor. It took 90 mins to deliver a small (250ml) jug of fresh milk (and then only after two reminder calls). Fortunately, the $4.50 charge was reversed at departure. It took 1 hour 15 minutes to deliver a cheese platter - thus causing us to be late for our dinner engagement. No apologies were offered. (We ended up consuming the cheese platter after we returned!) It was such a shame that the very slow in-room catering let down the rest of the team. I sincerley hope this is a "one-off" incident, as I would hate it to degrade what is an otherwise outstanding 5 star property. Valet parking was prompt and courteous, and my wife was thoroughly impressed with the facial she received at the spa. Overall, we did enjoy our stay and recommend it to other travellers - notwithstanding that for us, the in-room catering was not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money for the room, service and view”
Reviews.Author: Wordage
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Park Hyatt Sydney on 27 July 2010. The experience was so positive that, after benefiting from countless TA reviews but always never getting around to reciprocating, I am finally doing my first review. I have coveted staying at this hotel for many years but it's not exactly within our usual price range. If I couldn't hide out in the Maldives or Morocco for a big birthday, then staying overnight somewhere special in our own home town would have to do. I really didn't expect, though, for the reality to fully live up to the "dream" or the hype or even the cost, but thankfully I was wrong. Maybe it helped that it was a quiet time of year, or that I wasn't jetlagged, or the complimentary bottle of sparkling wine that was delivered to our room after the concierge learned of our special occasion, or the late check out. One can also become fairly blase about an icon such as the Sydney Opera House when it's in your own backyard, so to speak. But at the opening of the remote controlled curtains of our Opera View Room, the Opera House looked sensational and new. The staff at the Park Hyatt were also among the friendliest I have experienced, impressing as quite genuine in their attentiveness and care. Alex in the Club Bar, and Ronnie, one of our concierges, were particularly helpful and friendly. The only negative to the night also ended up with a positive. We decided to dine in our room to get every cent's worth of our stay and the view. The cost of the meal was waivered, unsolicited by us, when one of the steaks was not cooked quite to our original request. Overall, the hotel is at the high end of the Sydney price range and, of course, we deserved to get what we paid for - it was just very nice indeed to actually have that outcome. Definitely recommend this hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms, Fantastic Concierge”
Reviews.Author: NoSleepTillMnhtn
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt in Syd certainly stands out as one of the top hotels I've stayed. The rooms were very comfortable and large, the ameneties plentiful, and all staff very helpful. I cannot compare to other top-tier Sydney hotels, but across the world, this earns 5 stars. Only disapointment is that after my SOs 5 prior stays with great views and mid-level Hyatt elite status, this 6th stay with me as a tourist earned us room 017 with a view of the taxi stand on the street. Better rooms were confirmed available at check-in by the desk clerk, but he would only offer us to pay the difference above her corporate rate. Understandable, but still frustrating as this time was more important to get a view than any other stay! Oh well. Pros: +Really comfortable room, great bathroom full of ameneties. Free water is something all top-tier hotels need to do! +Great concierge staff, helpful as could be. Two concierges for a relatively smaller hotel was impressive. Cons: -Price is considerably higher than other 5-star hotels in Sydney. Not sure if the price meets the value if paying non-corporate prices. -Internet was a pricey $25/day

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury and best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mathpoet87
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Hyatt on the last night of our honeymoon. We were not willing to spend $800 for one night (we'd rather have had two more nights on Green Island instead), but we got the night free with a Hyatt promotion. The place was simply amazing. Best view of the Opera House in the city, opposite a private pier where no ships can dock to block the view. From our balcony, we looked left, and there it was. Right below the Harbour Bridge too (we recommend climbing the steps to the South Pylon observation deck), in the heart of The Rocks--fantastic! Great entertainment in the bar, and excellent staff. The room itself was superb, with a marble bathroom and very comfortable bed, even with remote-controlled curtains! Is it worth $800? Again, I'd take two nights on Green Island instead in a heartbeat, but if you have the means (or get lucky like we did), the Park Hyatt can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “BEST FIVE STAR PLUS HOTEL IN MY TRAVELS, AND I HAVE BEEN TO SOME OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: susannaa2000
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Hotel and Staff are some of the best in the world.....One of the most beautiful and breathtaking locations, Amazing rooms and service, Delicious and Gourmet Food , Beautiful Facilities, Great Location, Super Private, Super Quiet Rooms, amazing amazing hotel in every way, I am very well travelled and this is by far on the top of my list ....The stay began with a warm welcome and check in from the Front Office Manager Leigh Shepheard, he was so kind and professional...and nothing was missed.The Opera House View rooms are so priceless...The rooftop pool and jacuzzi are really nice as well..There is a view from sitting in the jacuzzi of the Opera House....I would go on and on about the comforts and luxuries of this hotel but I think I have made my point...I was travelling with my dad who also enjoyed his room and service and we both loved it and would recommend to anyone who is into sophistication, luxury and friendliness...Also for people who want to make their trip to Sydney the most memorable...Nothing and no location or hotel in Sydney could top this one!!!! thanks to everyone in the front desk area, concierge and food service....it was terrific

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: HamburgBowmore
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong staying at the Park Hyatt, Sydney. It has the best situation at the foot of the Sydney Harbour Bridge opposite to the Opera. what a treat to push the button and look at the Opera while the curtains open. Nice restaurant, good food, drinks and services. The only negative point is that they will close next year for renovation, which will make it even better. Where shall we stay while they will close?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see and enjoy Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jimpulcrano
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, perfect rooms, a good gym, nice pool and hot tub and friendly staff. My only complaint was that the bar closed at midnight on a Friday,but the view of the opera house from the hot tub made up for it. Skip the hotel breakfast buffet and head for The Rock Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: FredH71
Reviews.Content: Having only recently discovered, and taken advantage of trip advisor I thought it time to write a review. My wife and I regularly visit Sydney and for the past four years have always stayed at the Park Hyatt. Location is extraordinary - worth the extra $ for a room with a view of the Opera House. Service throughout the hotel is always spot on. The concierge service in particular is worth taking advantage of; have helped organise a variety of side trips for us over the years. One that will never be forgotten was a two night getaway via seaplane to Jonah's at the northern beaches of Sydney. Being on Sydney Harbour you can organize a water taxi directly to Manly, Rose Bay (where the seaplanes take off and only ten minutes from the hotel) and just about anywhere with a wharf. The inhouse restaurant is worthy of its location but don't forget there are half a dozen one, two and three hat restaurants with-in walking distance. Concierge can be very helpful with last minute reservations. Suggest - Guillaume at Bennelong, Aria, Galilao and Quay. Cant talk highly enough of the place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: denise40smile
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and jet lagged in the early hours of the morning and our room (understandably) wasnt ready - but were welcomed by the manager (a 'celeb' was on the same flight/in same hotel as us - I cant imagine he would normally do that - but it was nice) but they treated us to a complimentary breakfast and we watched the sun rise over sydney opera house from the comfort of our breakfast table. The location and the view is amazing. We went out for a walk and they phoned us a couple of hours later to say our room was ready - having fast tracked house keeping when the previous guest had checked out. The room was well appointed and comfortable - worth paying the extra for a harbour view. The concierge staff were helpful and attentive and sorted things out when our pre-booked trip to the Blue Mountains failed to show up - they made them come back and fetch us :-) They booked us fab trips and made great eating out recommendations. Customer service at reception and breakfast were first rate. Laundry service excellent but a little pricey. Overall a wonderful start to our grand tour of Australia. We went a few years before the date indicated - but it wont let you "back review" and ive only just got properly into trip advisor - which is a great website.

Reviews.Title: “Great top tier hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamW_Sydney
Reviews.Content: I arrived about 2:15pm for my two night stay and went through check-in where I was told that the room wasn't quite ready yet. As I was in my home city and not coming off a long flight or similar, this wasn't a problem and I went and had a drink in the bar followed by a nice walk around the park and pier surrounding the hotel. The room became available just after 3:30pm and I was escorted to the room by the same friendly person who checked me in earlier. The room was on the second floor, at the curve of the main building that comes around to face the Opera House. The views of the harbour from the balcony were wonderful and definitely a prime attraction of the room. The double doors were effective in keeping the noise of the harbour out during the night almost entirely. Some of the furniture items might be in need a bit of refurbishment but it was still very comfortable. We had breakfast in the hotel on both mornings, we ordered off the menu rather than the buffet, delivery of the meals was quite slow on both occasions - but to be fair the restaurant must have been close to, if not full both times. I really enjoyed the truffled scrambled eggs, rocket and parmesan with a side of Barossa Valley "Schultz" bacon and my girlfriend had two different egg dishes that I was told were nice, so it was worth the wait. Not much else of interest to report - a repair person turned up around 5:30pm on the first afternoon asking if there was a problem with one of the doors closing, but we hadn't had any problems. A late check out was granted which was appreciated. All in all, I found the staff to be brilliant and the room and location were spectacular. I'm very much looking forward to my next stay here later this month.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Bostravelguy
Reviews.Content: Location great, room spacious and staff extremely helpful. The only place to stay in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but a little old and a little dull”
Reviews.Author: JayODHK
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel but would probably try another next time in Sydney, particularly as the price is top of the range. The hotel is celebrating its 20th anniversary & it shows a bit - everything is sparkly clean and nothing is tatty but it all just seems, well, very 1990. Pale ash furniture & lots of mirrors in the room, none of it very stylish, leaves you with a cold feeling. Hotel only has 3 floors so the scale is intimate & every contact we had with staff was perfect & genuinely warm & welcoming. Views of the harbour & depending on the room & how you crane your neck, the Opera House, are nice. Big problem may be the location - Circular Quay area is very touristy & the hotel is well out of the way of things tucked under the Harbour Bridge. We live in HK but are from New York & it felt like we were staying at the South Street Seaport - which, if you aren't familiar, is just a major no-no (think mimes, break dancing exhibitions, deranged seagull attacks & screaming teen tour groups). Because it is so out of the way, you need to trudge through that street performing & other nonsense for at least 10 minutes to get into the CBD & find anything resembling real city life going on. By taxi, the winding route to The Rocks will cost you an extra AU$ 5 to 7 & 5 -10 minutes for every ride to & from. To sum up, it's very clean & everyone treats you like a welcomed guest, but at these price points you probably want a little more, beginning with some style & a better, hipper location.

Reviews.Title: “Pity the food didn't match the music and views”
Reviews.Author: Tavare
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer I went to the Park Hyatt on a Saturday night to enjoy the music in the bar and the wonderful views. The Sydney Opera House was being used as a light show, so we had a feast of attractions to make it (potentially) a memorable evening. The jazz music was very good - they were quite well-known Sydney musos - but unfortunately the very ordinary bar food, high prices and ordinary service didn't match the music or the light show. My wife's bloody mary was undrinkable, and while they tried to "repair" it, no one seemed perturbed that it was left untouched. The wine list was - not surprisingly - on the expensive side, which fails to take into account that wine (Aussie and overseas) is at historically low prices. In the end it was a good night that could have been much better. No other hotel in Sydney has such a prime location, but you can't just wrest on your laurels and assume that's all you need do. By the way, does anyone know other places in the city which have similar lounge bars with live jazz where you can actually talk without shouting?

Reviews.Title: “extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sherlockholmes93
Reviews.Content: We ate in the bar on a Saturday evening. The menu was pretty unexciting. The kids ordered macaroni cheese & a pizza. The macaroni cheeese was awful - congealed tasteless and unappealing. The pizza was pretty uninspiring and burnt at the edges. The vegetables didn't arrive until we were half way through the main course. We refused to pay for the kids meals. The complaint was handled well but all we wanted was a decent meal without the hassle of having to complain. We defintely would not go back & wouldn't recoomend it. There are far better places.

Reviews.Title: “POTENTIALLY BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: D50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this Hotel in the past five years. First time around it was just superb - in many ways jaw-dropping; fabulous location, magnificent rooms, wonderfully efficient, discreet and thoughtful service, good food...all was wonderful, fully justifying the top-notch price. Second time around the price seemed to have accelerated fantastically, while the Hotel itself had regressed in several significant ways. We sensed resting on hard-won laurels, an assumption of being "The best in Town" without any longer exercising the painstaking attention to detail which would first win, and then retain, such an assessment. Superbly furnished, very well equipped and comfortable rooms still prevailed - customer service had fallen off considerably - and it showed. When key swipe cards failed to work we were told "You must've done something wrong" . In an allegedly world-class 5-star Hotel a default mode that the customer has it wrong might justifiably be judged...inadvisable. We thought standard of food and cafeteria - not restaurant - service had also declined. Feeling after previous wonderful experience of this Hotel was of disappointed regret. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, these things can be cyclical, and every staff member can have an off day...or weekend. Our impression, however, was of a general malaise, general decline. Advise is to expect the very best, but be braced for another "off day". Rooms and location should not disappoint, however. In essence, a great Hotel...offering standards that, in our experience, have great pitential, not consistently fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “top view”
Reviews.Author: luzy_2002
Reviews.Content: Top end Room with view onto the opera house and harbour bridge. Great atmosphere and lovely service. Best location in town with exclusive views. Hard to find on street parking. Great restaurant in hotel. Short walk to the most important sightseeing spots in town. Very good hotel to spend a romantic weekend or even a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you won't want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaL1604
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from my first stay at the Park Hyatt Sydney and I hope it won't be the last. We stayed 2 nights and I didn't want to leave. A beautiful room...a beautiful view....stay here and you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “No words to describe it ....... the best for me ...”
Reviews.Author: shahrin_haron
Reviews.Content: I don't know where and how to start my review ... i've been staying with hyatt since my first hyatt in dubai 3 years ago ... This is so far the best hotel in term of everythng .. from services, location and all of it .. It started even before my first day .. Hyatt sydney was very kind to pick up us from nearby hotel and we were greated nicely .. I will always remember Mr Nicholas from from desk which I believe did his very best to ensure me and my family get the best .. yes .. the view from room 308 is speechless ...also not to forget the guys from the concierge which always there to assist day and night ... is like coming back home ... warm, cozy and always feel welome ..nothing in my previous stay in different hotels throughtout the world .. come close to his Hyatt Sydney .. my wife love this place very very much ... i believe no other hotel in sydney can come close to park hyatt ..(oh ya ..we spent 3 weeks in sydney .. and stayed at four seasons and hilton sydney as well .. but Park Hyatt is far far away from them .. especially hilton sydney ** read my review there** ) i will come again and again for sure ...

Reviews.Title: “Great position, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: MinnieD45
Reviews.Content: This was undoubtedly the most professionally run hotel I stayed at in Australia. Although the other hotels claimed to be 4* and 5* this was the one of two that lived up to its 5* rating. The staff were properly trained and there were plenty of them, hardly any seemed to be Australian to judge by their accents ( Eastern European, Far Eastern?) perhaps they knew the difference between laid back and poor service. The position is superb, right on the water front and close to all facilities and transport links. Because it is close to the bridge the traffic can be heard from the balcony but the double double-glazing cuts out all noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: Certainly, for anyone unfamiliar with Sydney, the location of the hotel is as good as it gets in Australia. It is lovely to spill out of the hotel and be surrounded by icons like the Opera House, Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge. The hotel itself ticks all the boxes and then some. The rooms are stylish without being pretentious and the service was always very timely and discrete. It was quite expensive but there is nowhere I would rather stay in Sydney. I wish I could have slowed down time. The only negative was the pool, which is small and accessible via a steep, shallow staircase, which seemed (and was) quite dangerous. It is unlikely that the designers had a pool scene in mind when drawing up the plans and it has a last-minute, tick-the-box feel to it. Still, the clientele aren't backpackers so perhaps it doesn't matter too much.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: spud2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on our wedding night back in march. apart from the wedding i was very excited for our stay here as it is well known as the best hotel in sydney. we arrived at the hotel after our location photos with our wedding party and before our reception to freshen up with our bridal party. My husband went to check us in and i noticed it was taking quite some time to do so, so i went over to make sure it was all ok. i should not have worried as when i got over there i was told we had been upgrade to the highest suite in the hotel... i nearly fell off my chair. the staff were amazing, they were all very friendly and efficent... our bags and my wedding dress bags were all hanging in the closet when we arrived back at our room at 1am along with champagne and strawberries and choccies, and room service we ordered at 2am arrived very quickly.. thank goodness as i had not eaten al day. the next morning we were served breakfast at our dining room table which was amazing. the rooms were very very clean and the bathroom spa was gorgeous. It was the icing on the cake for our wedding and i will most definatley be going back in years to come... thankyou to all the staff for making our night so special

Reviews.Title: “Extreme luxury and great location”
Reviews.Author: Thierrydsmt
Reviews.Content: Very large, luxurious room and bathroom; very impressive service; best location by far in all of Sydney; great bar. Better than the Four Seasons or the Observatory Hotel. Like many modern hotels, lacks some soul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,just don't use the phone!”
Reviews.Author: Eatenwell
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous Premier suite and it was so quiet. We left for a couple of days and they only had a Opera Deluxe room on our return, that was not so quiet, but had a stunning view. Everything was great until I got the final bill, they had charged me $150 for 7 phone calls, never lasting more than a few minutes, to my friends' Sydney cell phone number! I was shocked, especially since I checked the hotel book, local calls it said were $1.25. Be warned of this old hotel trick of charging you unreasonable prices for phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AirMilesLuvr
Reviews.Content: This was an important trip for us & we spent weeks researching our Sydney property so afraid we'd pick the wrong hotel. Not only we were shocked at what a great choice we'd made, we could not imagine anyone being able to say anything negative about this hotel. Note that we began our Australian holiday in Sydney, went to other cities (whose hotels I will also review) & returned for 1 night to Sydney for our early morning departure back to the U.S. the following day. In an effort to "try something new" we made the mistake of staying at The Establishment (see my review) instead of the Park Hyatt. I urge you to learn from my mistake! LOCATION: Nestled almost under the Harbor Bridge, on the Harbor & directly across from the Opera House, its location cannot be beat. We awoke to the most amazing sunrises over the Opera House & drifted to sleep to the same view each night. SERVICE: Everyone was attentive, accommodating, incredibly nice & most professional. David (Dave?) at the Concierge was most notable. Arranging for the hotel's free bicycles for us, dinner reservations, a Harbor Bridge climb, Symphony tickets, etc. During our bike ride, we decided to check out the Four Seasons (one of the other properties we'd considered). Wow. The most dated & depressing looking hotel - cannot believe it's a Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location. Room not ready.”
Reviews.Author: bigdave764
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a wide range of hotels through work and the Park Hyatt Sydney has a fantastic location and is a very pleasant overall experience. The rooms are large, the bed comfortable and the view from the rooms are the best in Sydney. The Rocks is also a great part of Sydney to stroll around, with some great bars and restaurants. My wife and I stayed at the hotel for one night in March 2010 and the only thing which was well below expectations was the availability of our room on check-in. Normal check-in is quoted as 2pm and I requested early check-in on our reservation. Despite this (and the Hyatt claim of 'expedited check-in' for Platinum members), our room wasn't available until 4.45pm and we both felt that the receptionist had a slight tone of false sincerity when dealing with us. I felt this was pretty poor for a top-end hotel - we ended up having to rush to get ready to go out for a function (we had a taxi booked for 5.30pm), when we were expecting a relaxed afternoon in our room. After a polite written complaint to the Manager, I got a letter back saying sorry and promising to give us special treatment on future reservations, but it doesn't really fix the past in my view. Nevertheless, I hope this was an isolated incident because I generally find Hyatt hotels are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service, rooms, view, I could go on and on”
Reviews.Author: travel_ann_NY
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty perfect. The staff is fantastic, rooms are clean and the views are amazing of the opera house. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, huge bathroom with great tub. The nearby Renaissance Patisserie is fantastic. Ate at Tetsuya's also but I would not go back; not worth the hype for that price.

Reviews.Title: “The more I stayed at this hotel, the more I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one to review. On one hand the hotel is fantastic and on the other hand I think it is really overpriced. I want to be fair to the hotel and at the same time I am thinking of the traveller coming to stay here and spending a fortune and then discovering for the price, it is not actually that great value. So if money is no object, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, spending the asking price and expecting something out of this world, then you may be a little dissapointed. Everything about this hotel was very professional. The valet parking was a breeze and the check in was as others already mentioned very, very professional and courteous. We were invited to sit down at a desk during the check in and that was a very pleasant first impression. Once check in was completed, the same receptionist who checked us in took us all the way to the room and she showed us how to operate the curtains (there is a remote control for closing and opening the curtains), and she also gave usa mini tour of the room (showed us where the aircon was located, the minibar, about the spa, etc,etc). Our only dissapointment was when she told us the outdoor pool was closing at sunset and of course we arrived after the sunset. Nevertheless we went to the pool the following morning and we were once again pleasantly impressed to see the place was clean and the pool was heated and you could just walk straight into it. There were also plenty of towels by the pool. The room was nice with a nice bath and lots of shampoos, and bath salts and bath robes and slippers. There were some minor stains on one of the leather couches and you could tell the housekeeping tried to rub them off unsuccessfully. Me mentioning this may seem a little pitiful but I am only mentioning this for those who may choose to spend the extra money expecting everything to be absolutely impecable. It's not impecable but it's probably as close to impecable as you can get. A few other nice touches were the complimentary fruit bowl, the two complimentary bottles of water on the bed side tables, and the free drinks voucher. Also the welcoming hand written note from the manager was a nice touch as well. The food in the restaurant was nice and not too over priced. Oh yeah, our room (125) did not have a full view of the Sydney Opera House. You can only see it from the balcony but not from inside the room, which leads me to believe not all rooms have a view of the Sydney Opera House but all balconies do. The staff was very polite and very accomodating and they extended our checkout time past their normal check out time without any problems at all. Checkout was also a breeze and there was another separate desk dedicated to the checkout. Arghhh... I forgot the girls name at the checkout (I remember she was from Brazil) but she was very, very professional, very helpful and very courteous. And one other thing I forgot to mention which was really nice was you could use the internet totally free for 30minutes in their business centre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: midway42
Reviews.Content: Check-in: As expected at a hotel of this caliber, I was met at the door by an attendant within seconds of leaving my taxi. Registration is a personalized affair similar to Park Hyatt Tokyo, completed while sitting in front of a receptionist behind a desk. Everyone I initially encountered was very obliging and friendly. Accommodations: I stayed five nights in a king â€œOpera House viewâ€� room. Like all Park Hyatt properties, the rooms are sparsely decorated but immaculate. The bathroom was very spacious with both a stand-up shower and separate large bath tub. A light bulb was out above the mirror (no big deal, it happens) and a simple phone call corrected this in minutes. The walk-in closet was more than adequate for the needs of a single traveler and the bed was perfect. I would have preferred some outdoor lighting on the balcony but Iâ€™m being picky here to be sure, overall the room was excellent. The pool and spa are a bit small, but itâ€™s a smaller hotel so this makes sense. Dining: I ate 3-4 times in the Harbor Kitchen and Bar/Little Kitchen. Although they are advertised separately on the website they are essentially served by the same kitchen just on different sides of the same room, one being more formal (Kitchen & Bar) and the other less so (Little Kitchen). Food was excellent and had service to match. I decided to try the afternoon tea (which usually requires 24-hour reservations), was seated the same day, and enjoyed the experience at a window seat. Room service was also five-star quality. Location: Canâ€™t be beat, to be honest. Youâ€™re staying under one of the worldâ€™s most iconic structures (Harbor Bridge) while overlooking another (Opera House). The ferries and tram system are a 5-10 minute walk away, as is the Rocks neighborhood with all of its shops and restaurants. Campbellâ€™s storehouses are within sight of the harbor entrance and house a number of varying restaurants. Service: So itâ€™s 4:30 in the morning the day my flight leaves and I decide to check my flight time on the business centerâ€™s complimentary computers before leaving for a run around Hyde Park. My key card did not allow access in the center (one of the few missteps of my five day stay) but one of the staff noticed me struggling with this and because he recognized me from earlier in the week (itself an impressive feat) ushered me into the center and apologized for the inconvenience. â€œIs there anything else I can do for you sir?â€� This level of attention to detail was seen consistently through my time at the hotel. Cost: Itâ€™s still difficult for me to rationalize how much these â€œexperiencesâ€� cost, but keep in mind the following: you are staying in one of the most expensive, international cities in the world that functions as a gateway to a very desirable country/continent for even casual travelers and the hotel overlooks an iconic World Heritage Site (see picture taken from my balcony). Itâ€™s not cheap. Summary: Along with the Hotel Adlon in Berlin, Park Hyatt Tokyo, and Raffles Singapore I think this hotel ranks right up there with one of the worlds best for an overall experience. I look forward to making another visit in the years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: prospect316
Reviews.Content: situated directly across from the beautiful Sydney Opera house and outside the hotel is the ship where "Bounty" starring Mel Gibson. Many nice scenic restuarants available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with iconic view”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Park Hyatt as part of a five week round the world tour. The torrential rain which greeted us and llasted for two days did not detract from the enjoyment of our stay and we made good use of the nearby harbour ferries to visit friends at Greenwich and Manly. We dined in the restaurant for the first night and for the next two days for breakfast which was very good. There is a great charade about getting a window table which have the best views but by negotiation we managed to progress over two days from the inferior rear row of tables through the middle row then to the front row. When we asked on the second day if we could take one of the front row tables which were empty we were told these were reserved. We asked if we could reserve one of the front row tables for the following day, only to be told that they don't take reservations! After a few minutes we were then told that one of the empty front row tables had beome vacant so we eventually got what we wanted. This hotel is expensive and we booked one of the more expensive full Opera House view rooms which was on the third (top) floor. Watching one of the large cruise liners depart majestically to the sound of music from our balcony was majical and there is so much activity in the harbour. All in all, a great hotel with excellent service, but you do have to work to get front row seats in the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “The finest service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: timbonit
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favour and treat yourself to this hotel. The service was like I have never ever experienced before. The head Conciegre, Cameron, Is an amazing person, nothing was too difficult. Fantastic Hotel - Fantasic Location

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel Makes You Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PetermanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: As repeat holiday visitors to Sydney, all we really wanted to do was relax in the room and possibly stir for dinner. It rained the entire 3 days we stayed here and even so, we couldn't have been happier! A view of the Opera House and the boats in the harbour; dark, silent broad hallways; understated and perfectly intuitive service. Just outstanding. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Sydney Park Hyatt has the most refined, unpretentious 5-star service possible.”
Reviews.Author: 5starTravelnut
Reviews.Content: My husband & I started our 3 week Australia itinerary with a 3 night stay in an opera room at the Sydney Park Hyatt. We arrived 7 hrs. late because a huge dust storm caused havoc with our flight from Los Angeles, but check-in was very fast & attentive. Little coupons we had for complimentary refreshments were redeemed, plus welcome champagne & chocolate-covered strawberries from our travel agent were already in our room when we entered. It's as if the staff quickly assessed our travel weariness & got us settled without fuss. Despite our 40 hour travel ordeal, we revived is less than a half hour. The room was wonderful--very, very clean, airy, comfortable, nice bed, perfect linens--everything you would expect of a 5-star property. Of course, the incomparable view of the Opera House from the balcony made us forget our fatigue & we began to enjoy our holiday from the very first moment. Despite our speedy check-in, we had very little time to get to our reserved Bridge Climb & the concierge assisted us most ably. We loved the concierge here as they helped us also with our day trip to the Blue Mountains as well as with little & big recommendations throughout our stay. They seemed to pick up on our interests & preferences very quickly. They also never failed to ask us how our plans went--it made our stay very warm & personable. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, but it was wonderful. I had stayed here once before in 2004 & breakfast was abysmal at that time. Now it was good & with a better entrance to the dining room. Service & check-in has improved since 2004 as well. We can't imagine how anything could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_ocean
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Sydney rates among the best hotels I've experienced (Peninsula Hong Kong, Claridge's London, George V Paris etc.). The most gorgeous location in Sydney, outstanding service, immaculate and comfortable rooms, excellent restaurant and bar. Sparking and near perfect bathrooms, beautiful linens, unobtrusive room make-up and turn down, speedy room service and requests for transportation arrangements etc. were handled timely and accurately. We stayed at the hotel over Australia Day and the information from the staff about the festivities around the harbor and elsewhere around the city was wonderful and made us feel Australian for the day! Kudos to a world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: sydneywebshopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Opera room with a direct view of the Opera House; room was spacious and the bathroom to die for. We also held our wedding ceremony & reception on the rooftop terrace - staff are extremely professional, courteous and efficient. The service is excellent on all fronts, highly recommended and one of our favourite high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Sydney *****”
Reviews.Author: amadeaus
Reviews.Content: You could not get a better location than your bedroom, meters above the blue Pacific harbour and right opposite the spectacular Opera House. You can walk 'round the quays, take a boat anywhere and you are downtown. The rooms are stunning. Each like a small suite large TV, DVD, in room bar. Breakfast in your room with the sliding doors open with a view like that is just wonderful.Ther is a huge marble bathroom, very large shower and bath, huge towels. Large floor to ceiling windows give you a magnificent view of the harbour and as the hotel is built on historic land, it is only allowed to be three floors high. There is a pool on the top floor. You lie there in the sun sipping a cocktail looking at a view that is stunning. The staff are young and very attentive with a typical Aussi informality. Their restaurant is one of the finest in Sydney. We have stayed there six times now & we live in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, spacious room with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ren200sydney
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a Opera deluxe room. We used the room to get ready for my daughter's wedding the next day. It was a lovely large room with a limpressive bathroom,separate toilet and 2 balconies ( although the balconies are quite narrow.). The staff were very helpful with all of our requests including allowing our makeup artist to park her car while she was there. The room was expensive but I feel it was money well spent - I would definitely stay there again for another special occasion. We were on the second floor - not sure if I would like the first floor as much as there is a park and boardwalk out the front which can get quite busy with wedding ceremonies, joggers, tourists etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Australia, but overrated service”
Reviews.Author: JonnyHei
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Park Hyatt to stay for 5 nights. Our room wasn't ready upon arrival (20-30 min) and we were invited to the bar for a complimentary drink. After an hour the room still wasn't ready. 2 hours later, we were comfortably situated in our room. However, the next day the TV wouldn't work! We were promised a fruit plate -- nice -- but it never arrived. Other than this sub-par service, the hotel is above average. We selected a king Opera View room and basically fell asleep and awoke with a 180 degree view of the Opera House, quay and wharf. The Hyatt thoughtfully installed double doors on their balconies which cancel out any outside noise. Food and room service at the hotel were stellar, but expensive. The concierges arranged several dining reservations for us which were A+ experiences. Overall, the hotel was enjoyable but not worth the $700+ per night charge for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Service”
Reviews.Author: 4familySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Park Hyatt Sydney from just before Christmas to almost New Years. This hotel should really be in a category by itself because of the unique location in the rocks and exceptional service. Yes it's expensive as other reviews have noted. But this hotel delivers for the money. It's worth staying a shorter time to stay at this property. We returned after an almost 8 year absence wondering if the hotel would be able to match our memories from before and it did. As other reviews have noted, it's well worth paying the extra money for an opera deluxe room open floor plan suite (750 sq ft) as the view and space are magical. The beds are ultra comfortable, the bathroom will match the best bathroom anywhere and the living and work space are well thought out. You feel like you can reach out and touch the boats on the harbor from the rooms. This is one of the few modern five star hotels left that operates in the traditional customer service of years past. We were greeted by the very capable Leigh Shepheard at check in and we found all of the departments to be excellent including the bell desk (Shawno) reception (Renato) room service (too many great people to list) etc.. When you phone for anything, housekeeping, bell desk, room service, etc the staff reacts quickly and tries to over anticipate needs. Our average wait for room service was less than 20 minutes, even on Christmas Day. It reminded my husband and me of visits to Claridges in London where they must somehow keep a list of requests from visitors. The hotel staff will even do completely unexpected touches as when my son somehow misplaced a stuffed animal given to him for Christmas - Hans arranged to surprise him with a special "park hyatt bear" etc.. The hotel gave us lovely home made delicious cookies for Christmas Day and boxing day etc... The Park Hyatt Sydney does not nickel and dime guests like so many hotels. Guests may use the fast four computers in the business center without a charge. They don't charge an extra service charge for room service delivery and don't force gratuity or tips ever. It's a standard two full housekeeping services a day as well as bottled water by the bedside, ice bucket filled - even champagne, water, and wine glasses changed daily. It's a very luxurious feeling to be a guest in the hotel. The hotel is small and well sound proofed. We never heard other guests or outside noise even though the hotel is located on a very busy and noisy part of the city. My family disagrees with some of the recent trip advisor reviews of the food and/or ambience in the hotel. We ate two of three meals daily using room service, the harbourkitchen and the harbourbar (serves a lighter menu) and found the food and service to be consistently superb. In fact we had friends from Sydney dine with us on several occasions and all felt that the harbourkitchen was a secret find. It's a fabulous place to be at night but still welcoming to families. They offer a discounted lunch on weekdays that includes a glass of wine and valet parking for $39. Given how expensive Sydney's main restaurants are right now for Americans we found this to be a terrific bargain and an easy way for our friends to visit us. The harbourkitchen has modern doors that lift to the ceiling so most days you are literally on the harbor. Even if you aren't staying at the hotel it's worth a visit to eat or have a drink. We also disagree with some of the comments about the health club, pool, and spa. This is a small hotel so we wouldn't expect a large gym. The gym had a variety of exercise equipment including a complete set free weights, bars, and balls with a lovely view of the harbor. It's identical to the gym at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park and appropriate for this size hotel. Very few hotels in Sydney have a pool yet alone one that is outdoors. We did try a service at the spa and found it to be lovely. Another secret of this hotel is that it houses one of the best concierge teams worldwide. We found the concierge to be very useful organizing a decorated Christmas tree in our room, water taxis, car service, appropriate restaurants to take our kindergarten age son, a pirate ship dinner on the harbor, to helping us figure out the right shows and seats at the Opera House, etc... On several occasions we phoned them last minute from a day trip for help with directions, ferry times, New Year's eve venues or reservations. One night (boxing day) they were able to help us secure a coveted reservation dining literally on the sand at Le Kiosk on Shelley Beach in Manly when we spontaneously jumped on a Ferry. Chris, who manages the concierge team, had emailed us restaurant and dining lists prior to our trip and we found all of the recommendations to be on point for our family. We loved our visit to Sydney so much that we ended up staying over New Year's Eve to watch the fireworks from the Opera House party. Because the Park Hyatt was fully booked (New Year's is booked often a year or two in advance) we had to move to another hotel. The entire time we kept wishing that we were still at the Park Hyatt. Really - nothing else in Sydney compares to this property. There are lovely business hotels that have harbor views that are less money, but they aren't the same. A stay in an Opera View Deluxe Room at this hotel should be on everyone's bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: idlBrussels
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 nights with the whole family (4 kids age 10,14,16,17) in 1 opera Deluxe and 2 standard rooms. it is worth going for the Opera Deluxe rooms , what a view! Standard rooms where very dark. the best thing for us was to have a balcony and be able to have windows open en no need for airco. excellent service from reception to concierge and restaurant. we spent Newyears eve at the hotel restaurant second seating. quite expensive for nothing really special. good and flexible service. we appreciated the strawberries and champagne in the room. swimmingpool area is way to small for such a hotel (spa did not appeal at all going there). breakfast was included : buffet was very poor and boring for such a high standard hotel. every day the same, very long to replace empty trays this really needs improvement . this was the poorest buffet from our 3 weeks in different hotels in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Fifteen to Sydney and Auckland”
Reviews.Author: ruspotee
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt is an excellent hotel. Included in the amenities are double sliding doors to block out sounds, double remote-controlled drapes to block out light, and an LED pathway from the bed to the bathroom. And an incomparable view of the harbor and Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, great service”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumFogg
Reviews.Content: In a recent first trip to Sydney, we had stayed at the Shangri-La which is very good but the Park Hyatt has some nice extras that make it the best in town. Location is definitely one of the best in town and the service is wonderful, very accomodating to every single need and detail. Our room was not ready at the time they had indicated so they invited us to drinks at their opera-looking bar. if you can treat yourself to an opera-looking room in the third floor, go for it!!!! It is wonderful to wake up and see the opera so close. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant, great view and great food. One minor detail: people going from reception to the bar or viceversa tend to walk through the whole restaurant which is a bit disurbing to those having a meal; there is an alternative way but not well indicated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TandNLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Sydney. Only stayed one night in the Hyatt, but glad we did. We arrived early and Shawn, the front desk manager was great. Easy check in and took us strait to our room. I used the spa to get cleaned up after a long flight from the states. The spa area itself is nice, but way to small. Need to knock out a few more walls, just to make it comfortable. Like everyone else says, views were the best, close to a lot of places to eat. The best thing about the Hyatt was the Staff. All very friendly and helpful. Although, I am a diamond member at Hyatt, it was obvious to tell they treated everyone very well. Other than the coin you will be dropping at this place, you will be very pleased with this hotel, and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Grigs
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Location is fantastic - looking out over the harbour and the opera house and watching the ferry boats go by. All the rooms have great views. The harbour bridge arches above you. Easy to walk to the quay and lots of restaurants around. We ate in the hotel and wouldnt recommend it - food was ok but ambience wasnt good - we should have gone out. Service was excellent - rooms very comfortable and large. Lovely place to stay - would stay again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Just the best location possible in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: janetatt
Reviews.Content: We finished our tour of Australia with four nights at the Park Hyatt, and what a way to finish. Painless check in, as our driver had phoned ahead to say we were on our way, and stunning room with fantastic views of Opera House and harbour (and the bridge if you lent out !) from our double balcony. The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff were very helpful, and the breakfast fantastic, with lovely views over the harbour and opera house. The location was perfect for exploring Sydney, and wonderful for a an early morning run around the harbour to Mrs. McQuarrie's Seat. Expensive - but we thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Adventura1405
Reviews.Content: REVIEW: We arrived at Sydney airport at 7am after a 24 hour flight from the UK. We were met by the hotel's friendly driver (pick-up by luxury limo is an optional extra) and with minimal fuss were on our way to the Park Hyatt Hotel . The driver called ahead, so that when we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by name, taken through the speedy check-in process and shown to our room (where our luggage was already waiting) by a friendly receptionist. And yes, our room really was available at 8am! We booked a Opera Delux King but it was worth every cent. For AUD 1115 per night (including breakfast) you get plan studio suites with stylish uncluttered surrounding including a living room, bar and work area. Floor-to-ceiling sliding glass doors open out onto two private balconies overlooking Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. There is a separate bathroom and walk-in wardrobe. The two sets of curtains (voils and blackout) at the windows are operated by remote control, so you can lie in bed and watch the sun rise. Magnificent. There are so many other restaurants around the historic Rock district where the hotel is located that we tended to eat out save for breakfast and a midnight feast in our room after the opera (the room service was great). The hotel staff were very friendly and anticipated every need. I happened to come back to the room while one of the team was refilling the mini bar. He asked me if I would like him to clear some space in the mini bar for our own bottles of champagne, and when I said yes that would be nice, we planned on having a bottle when we returned from the Bridge Climb later in the afternoon, he promptly arranged for an ice bucket and glasses to be waiting for us when we returned. Lovely. SUGGESTIONS FOR IMPROVEMENT: The rooms would benefit from the addition of a docking station for an ipod / iphone / MP3 player. OTHER: Just one thing to be aware of. The small hotel pool is located on the roof and suffers from the noise of the long term repainting work being done of Sydney Harbour Bridge. Not a major factor, just a minor irritation. THINGS TO DO: The Rocks and Central Quays (a short walk) Manley Beach (catch the public ferry from Central Quays) Bondi Beach (take a taxi) The parks and gardens (a short walk) Bridge Climb (highly recommended) A night at the Opera House (highly recommended) Woolamooloo (take a taxi) The bar at the Establishment (take a taxi) OUR COMPLETE ITINERARY: Sydney: Park Hyatt (H) Blue Mountains: Lilianfels (H) Blue Mountains: Trek with Life's an Adventure (O) Nelsons Bay : Amarana Beach Resort (A) Port Macquarie: Quality Inn HW Boutique (H) Coffs Harbour: Promised Land Cottages (A) Byron: Byron at Byron (H) Gold Coast: Palazzo Versace (H) Airlie Beach: The Peninsula (A) Whitsunday Islands: Coral Trekker (O) Hamilton Island: Qualia (H) Darwin: Sky City (H) Litchfield National Park: Adventure Tours (O) Kakadu National Park: Adventure Tours (O) Ayers Rock (Uluru) & The Olgars (Kata Tjuta) National Park: Longitude 131Â° (H) Perth: The Richardson (H) (H) = Hotel (A) = Apartment (O) = Other

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city escape!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: We are from Sydney but decided to have two nights at this hotel to spoil ourselves! It was perfect! - from the moment we stepped out of our car to the time we had to , sadly, leave! All the staff were very professional and welcoming. The restaurants were great. Really fresh food and not fussy and 'overworked' Rooms are lovely. Views are spectacular. Perfect place to stay for tourists.... right on the harbour ! We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyageur Ã  paris
Reviews.Content: After travelling 24 hours from Western Europe to Sydney, with a full day of meetings looming at you through the gloom of what will most certainly be a night of jetlagged half-slumber, you want an hotel that is laid back, comfortable, and spacious. The Hyatt is this place. Check-in is painless and the staff are courteous, discreet, and accommodating. The hotel is located in the Rocks quarter of Sydney, just below the Harbour Bridge, with a beautiful view to the CBD, the Opera House, and harbour suburbs. The rooms are exceptionally spacious, the beds comfortable, and the bathrooms large and equipped with a great tub and separate shower. I have stayed in this hotel on numerous occasions over the past 10 years. The property has aged well and the standards of service are, I think, amongst the best in Sydney. Breakfast is a real treat, with beautiful views of the harbour from every table. The buffet is a bit pricey (aren't they always), but you can order an excellent "flat white" and some Greek yogurt with berries and get away only A$ 20 lighter. There's a decent gym facility, and if you're a runner, all you need to do is put on the trainers and step out the door to be on a great footpath that will take you as far up the harbour as you want. There are also a number of good restaurants steps away on the waterfront, and the ferry terminal to other areas of interest on the harbour is a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Moodytraveller
Reviews.Content: Have been to this hotel last year on business, and had to try it again with my family this time. Everything about the hotel is perfect especially the staff. The opera views are amazing. No other hotel in Sydney has such a view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ESB2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our wedding night, and it was amazing! Our room was huge - as was the bathroom! The service was fantastic, and the late check in was very easy. Fantastic view and very clean room. Was very special to wake up, lay in bed, the blinds open electronically and look out over the water and the big cruise ship that was in tnhe harbour! Very special - very Sydney! Breakfast was great - forgot our order, but very apologetic, which made up for it. Fantastic splurge - highly recommended if you can do it!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Indulgence”
Reviews.Author: yfb
Reviews.Content: A true five star experience with a five star view. As my taxi pulled up to the front door I was greeted warmly by three staff. One opened my door and guided me to my seat at the reception desk while the other two immediately retrieved my luggage from the trunk. I was also being promptly address my name as the porters checked my luggage name tags and began addressing me as such. The agent that checked me in immediately offered a late checkout, personally escorted me to my room, showed me the amenities and ensured that I was happy with the view. The agent also mentioned that if I might wish to take a night cap the bar downstairs was open late. I might have given this a skip but the hotel guide mentioned their well stocked scotch selection. I spent several minutes making my selections from a very thorough list. The bar man was friendly, very knowledgeable, and exceptionally professional. I enjoyed an exceptionally comfortable night as I drifted off to sleep in my huge bed gazing out across to the opera house. The next morning I had one of the better eggs benedicts I had in years as I sat out on my patio reading my newspapers. One negative of this property is the extra charge for in room internet. this seams to be a standard charge in Australia but it feels tacky at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be one of my worldwide favourites.”
Reviews.Author: Getabreak
Reviews.Content: This was actually my fourth time at Hyatt on the Rocks which makes business trips from UK to Sysney wothwhile despite the distance! Location is simply fantastic with perfect views, easy strolls and great food. Never feel lonely with all the sights and sounds and breakfast with this view is hugely memorable. On expenses, I wouldn't stay any where else in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, amazing hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: FanAticAl1
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Park Hyatt was totally pure indulgence! The views from our room are what I dreamt of as a kid, the Opera house view was amazing. The best 5 star hotel I have stayed at, great staff, great service, and amazing food. Ideally located for Circular Quay for the ferry to Manly and the train into the City. Will defintlatey stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the Extra”
Reviews.Author: Shaun52
Reviews.Content: A hotel that is well worth paying the extra for. The location is stunning with views across the harbour to the Opera House, and the Harbour Bridge. Rooms are a good size, with TV, mini bar, shower and balcony. With a short walk to South Quay and the ferries to attractions on the city. The breakfast is great and I advise you to try to the Ocean Trout ! Staff are great too and always happy to help and answer any questions. Well worth paying the extra over the Shangri La anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location”
Reviews.Author: anne9837
Reviews.Content: Yes it is expensive but the location more than made up for it - the view was stunning i.e. looking on to the Opera House; good for visitinig the Rocks markets and fir dining out as well as taking the ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Elegant Rooms and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vavoomvsc
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Ryan who gave us our room keys and walked us to our room. He showed us the features of the room and answered all the questions we had. (Thank you Ryan!) Park Hyatt has the best location in the Circular Quay area by far! We stayed in room 333 which gave us a great view of the Sydney Opera House and the City at the same time. Rooms are very quiet and the bed is a comfortable one. We only stayed one night but it was worthwhile and I recommend everyone spend at least one night here if you can make it happen. The Park Hyatt is definitely a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: scana22964
Reviews.Content: We have been on a round the world trip. Been on the road for almost 8 weeks and we are my husband and I are really discriminating, as we are in the resort/hospitality business in California. We have stayed in what are reputed to be the best hotels in the world on this trip and will, at some point, write reviews on all the hotels (i.e.Al Qasr, Dubai, Intercontinental Hong Kong, Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok ) . We are just about to pack our bags, having spent 5 great nights in what has to be one of the greatest locations of any city hotel imaginable. Sydney is not a 'cheap' city, but if you want to do it right then stay at Park Hyatt. Best location, the most wonderful staff. They are attentive, without being in your face. Our room had view of both bridge and opera house. Incredible! The concierge service was fantastic and George in informal restaurant and bar was one of the best maitre d's we encountered on our trip. Food was wonderful and everyone was so helpful. Shane, the bar tender gave us the best tips for sight seeing. Just an all round wonderful experience. Honestly can't find a fault. Our room was immaculately kept and cannot wait to come back. Loved Sydney and The Rocks is the most wonderful spot.

Reviews.Title: “It cost a bomb but the view was priceless”
Reviews.Author: glumball
Reviews.Content: Where does one go to celebrate a special occasion in Sydney? Which hotel has the best view in Sydney? The Park Hyatt in Sydney has an unrivalled view of the Opera House, Circular Quay and The Harbour Bridge so that was where we headed to celebrate a special birthday. The checkin was smooth, the room was modern and had all the amenities one could wish for and the view from the huge super king sized bed was super spectacular. This hotel afforded us an opprotunity to play at being tourists in our own city and what a beautiful town it is. After we checked in and examined our room we walked out of the hotel for a stroll around the Harbour's edge. To warm up after our walk we stopped by the hotel coffee shop for a coffee that was served hot and with some nice bikkies before retiring to that Opera View room that had cost us so much. Sitting on the balcony drinking a bottle of French champagne (brought from home) and watching the sun set over the Opera House as Sydney ferries popped in and out of their moorings at Circular Quay was a magical experience. As the room was so well equipped we stayed in for a room service dinner and watched a couple of DVDs we brought from home on the inroom DVD player and flatscreen TV. The dinner was warm well presented and delicious. During our stay we took advantage on a couple occasions of the deep tub in the marble bathroom; the towels were large and fluffy and the bathroom lotions and potions agreeable. When we announced on checkout thast we were attending a family lunch at the nearby Doyles restaurant at The Quay the staff had no hesitation in offering us complimentary parking for the rest of the day. The service, amenities and location of this hotel were excellent ... and so they should be for the price. We may never stay here again but would recommend it unreservedly to others for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “If you're tacky you might not like this place.”
Reviews.Author: penalba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only a night, using points rather than paying. I'm not sure any hotel is worth what this place charges, but it is certainly a lovely, top-of-the-line hotel in an ideal location. According to our very impressed taxi driver, it's the best hotel in town. Our room was beautiful, big and elegant but not over the top. Great views. It's not a marble-and-mirror palace; they've got Eames lounge chairs in the lobby. Classy, ya know? I read some of the other reviews of this place and I want to point out one thing: the staff here is great. Very friendly, not haughty or obsequious, but kind and attentive. The concierge found us a nice restaurant (Aqua, highly recommended) that was even sort of kid-friendly. We're not the target demographic for the Park Hyatt; we had two little kids in tow and didn't hang out at the bar. But the staff were great with our kids and made us feel at home, albeit a luxurious home.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a view...”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1745
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and had booked a Opera House view room, don't get me wrong this is an expensive option for staying in Sydney but if you've got the money or are aiming for a real treat this hotel is worth paying for and the upgrade to an Opera house view room is a must.. The rooms are modern and well equipped, the staff are very friendly and personnel and the location is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, enjoyable and amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Sn00pycat
Reviews.Content: Quite a posh hotel, but not overly posh. The rooms are huge and the beds are so SO comfortable. Our window looked across circular quay with the opera house the other side, and the harbour bridge right next to us, this hotel practically sits underneath the bridge! But you don't hear any noise from outside. Great location to wander round to circular quay to hop on a ferry. The outside is nice, but it doesn't fully represent how nice it is inside, you'll fiigure that out as soon as you step into the reception.

Reviews.Title: “good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: loveholiday78
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stay at this magnificent place location are just awesome .very easy distance to walk by and what a beautiful view we had. we even order food which i think reasonable price and i am so impress with the hotel . One day we will return in this magnificent places .

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World !!”
Reviews.Author: ConradCopperCCC
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hotel I have stayed in. From the location, to the room, to the service, to the view ! TWO THUMBS UP !! The door man was very friendly and helpful. Throughout my 6 nights stay, I had everyone assisting me in my every need from getting a taxi to arranging for a tour to getting dinner reservations! Unforgetable experience. Will be returning very soon !

Reviews.Title: “Easy luxury in the best spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Likesaholiday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights as a treat on our way from the UK to New Zealand for a year. We were delighted to be allowed to check in a few hours early having arrived first thing in the morning and found the staff courteous but approachable. Our room was categorised as 'Opera View Deluxe' (or something similar) and we were very happy that this description was accurate! The Opera House view was uninterrupted, it's viewing made easier by the remote controlled curtains, and the facilities were certainly of a high standard. Bed was big and comfortable, walk-in wardrobe meant it was easy to keep room tidy and the flat screen TV would be fine for anyone who should want to sit in and watch it! In the bathroom the shower pressure was good and the bath was deep yet filled quickly. I'm generally not a fan of hotel toiletries but quite liked those supplied here! We had breakfast included and certainly made the most of it: a superb spread of continental-style options, with particularly delicious fresh fruit, and a menu with the usual suspects such as eggs benedict, pancakes and smoked salmon bagel, all served to perfection. Our main disappointment was breakfast on the Saturday morning with a packed dining room, including walk-in diners. The service, having been excellent all week, was now appallingly slow and even though the staff were very apologetic we left unimpressed (still having had a good feed!) We didn't eat any other meals in the hotel due to the large selection of other restaurants in Sydney to enjoy. The location was perfect not only for the views but also accessibility to the main tourist spots. Being only a few minutes walk from Circular Quay where the ferries go to several areas of interest, and a train station, it's easy to get anywhere you might want to go! There was free internet in the 24hour business centre that was never busy but a charge for Wi-Fi. We didn't use the gym or rooftop pool (the weather being a little undesirable for outdoor swimming) but had a look. Both are quite small and would be busy with more than 3 people. There was however a recommended jogging route from the hotel. In summary, stay here if you want a bit of luxury in a relaxing hotel in a great location and like a good feed at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “too stuffy for sydney”
Reviews.Author: WheatStacker
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel far formal, the staff way to stuffy to the point often with the younger staff being so stiff as not to feel willing to be helpfut - perhaps they took their training too seriously. I would not stay here again, but I prefer the Observatory, but for business to impress clients, may be just right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Room”
Reviews.Author: Suniel14
Reviews.Content: On one side is the Sydney Opera and the other side is the Sydney Bridge. In between is all water and quay area and there lies the Park Hyatt. Rocks area is just 5 minutes walk. Central downtown area is 10 minutes walk. The hotel is an absoulte luxury in terms of room quality, food, service and the accessories supplied. The bathroom is huge and the room extremely spacious with all possible gadgets and gismos. Each room has a balcony and the view is grand! The hotel perhaps has no comparison in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Setting”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: If you want a view of the opera house and sydney harbor bridge, there is no better place to stay than the park hyatt. Within walking distance from both attractions. nice modern rooms, expensive but worth the view and setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Shame about the price”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastguy71
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with large rooms and a great view, but I can't see the value of the $625 asking price. If I was to stay again, I'd only pay $300 max. There just aren't enough bells and whistles to justify the hotel's room rate. One major downside is the TV reception is the worst I've ever seen. Zoomed and cropped picture and full of snow.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service!”
Reviews.Author: JacksTravels2009
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hyatt Sydney, and what separates this hotel from any other in Sydney is the service. Iâ€™ve stayed at the Four Season and Shangri La in Sydney for business on many occasions, however for a long weekend, I travelled with my wife for her birthday and wanted the best. And the best is what I got. The price tag for a weekend at Park Hyatt is expensive but the service and the view is exceptional. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, the staff were always present. The Bellmen were friendly, welcomed us warmly and ushered us to the reception desk. I had booked a Opera room but due to arriving early, the room was not ready, but instead of being asked to come back later, we were taken to the harbour with beautiful view of the Opera house for a complimentary drink while we waited for our room. In no time at all were collected from the Harbour bar and escort to the room by the Duty Manager, Andrew, and in my opinion, is an asset to the industry. He catered for everything from restaurant advice to shopping for my wife during the walk to the room. His recommendation for dinner for my wifeâ€™s Birthday was superb.
