We went with his advice and chose â€˜Est.â€™ at the Establishment hotel which was beautiful, and the hotel even organised a table at the cocktail bar afterwards. My wife thoroughly enjoyed herself, the food was superb and although we didnâ€™t go to the cocktail bar it was a great example of providing additional services not just a dinner reservation. Upon returning to the hotel, we had a night cap at the beautiful Club bar, which is one of the best Hotel bars Iâ€™ve visited, small, personalised and very comfortable. But what made the night, when we returned to the room, there was a cake, a bottle of wine and a card wishing my wife a happy birthday. The attention to detail offered here at the Park Hyatt should be an industry standard for 5 star hotels. Just phenomenal! The rooms are aged but maintained well and the amenities supplied were plentiful. The rooms are expensive compared to another hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in, however the personalised service offered at the Park Hyatt, and that unhindered view of the Opera House is worth every dollar. Congratulations to the management at the hotel, as the staff are the hotels greatest asset. The bell staff, concierge, receptionists and waiters were the friendliest weâ€™ve experienced during our travels over the years. Definitely the best city Hotel we have ever stayed at and we will definitely return in future!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mmpayton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must if you can afford it! Spectacular views of the Opera House! Best location in Sydney. Short walk to major points of interest....The Rocks, Darling Harbour, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, shopping, pubs and bars, etc. Staff is superb! Especially the concierge Cameron. He is the best! The entire staff was warm, accomodating, went above and beyond. The rooms, amenities, and restraurant were perfect. Overall a great experience. One of the the highlights of my trip to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: beachislandlover
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write this because I use Tripadvisor a lot to research where to stay next, and always trying to filter negative from the positives. I could not believe the amount of positive response for this hotel. This hotel is touted to be one of our best and maybe it is but comeon everyone what are you seriously comparing this to? I travel twice a year and check into all the top class hostels and resorts. Either the previous reviews have never been anywhere outside Australia, or it is not the customers who are providing the reviews. There is a clear lack of interest by the staff which is not unusual for Sydney hospitality generally. Also there was a touch of arrogance on top of this which was noticeable. The breakfast was fair but no wow factor at all. Our toilet seat lid kept falling off in our room. There was definately no value with this stay and will not be going back. We wrote a letter to the hotel to state our disappoint and issues with a very flat response. The room itself was reasonable and the view and location pretty good, so if this is what you want then if you pay enough, which is too much, then you get it. My suggestion is to try the fourseasons. The rooms are about the same, the service and food much better and the views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Weekend - very good hotel, maybe not quite as good as the reviews say though”
Reviews.Author: splatnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the easter weeked, a break from Sofitel where I usually stay. Likes - Very polite, genuine and friendly staff; definitely the highlight of the hotel - Excellent view and location; hard to fault looking at the Opera House every time you look out the window and right down at the Rocks so easy to get around. - Very good amenities from Vive - Good quality food at the restaurant - Good Amex FHR amenities (3 course lunch for 2 once during stay and contintental breakfast each morning (upgrade to full cooked buffet for AUD$5). - Good size bathroom and wardrobe Dislikes - Not as luxurious as some other Park Hyatt's, rooms well maintained but could do with a make over - Pool area is very 'Holiday Inn', it's on the roof which is fantastic but small pool and tiny spa. Couldn't see any changing rooms at the pool, no bar facilities etc. - Pricey internet - AUD55c per minute. Overall this is a very good hotel and I really enjoyed the staff and the location but it's not the most luxurious hotel in Sydney and maybe not worth the price unless you get a great deal (maybe AUD$350 per night). Having stayed at other Sydney hotels I think that there's maybe better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: cheeseburger23
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for a week on a two week holiday in Sydney in March 2009. Could not find a single fault with the hotel. First, the location of this hotel is incomparable. Just on the edge of the Rocks and Circular Quay, we were always a few yards away from things to do and food to eat. Second, the rooms are spectacular. We booked an Opera King and got upgraded to the larger room facing the Opera House. Every morning, we took photos of the sun rising over the opera house - the view was absolutely amazing. The room was perfection. Huge marble bathroom, giant walk-in closet, enormous sitting area, heavenly king bed, etc. Amenities were fantastic. We were given complimentary wine on arrival, and daily fruits and chocolates. Mini-bar was well-stocked, but we didn't use it since they gave us free water every day. We ordered room service almost daily, and it never took longer than 20 minutes, despite the fact that our room was the furthest from the elevator. The room service operators were the perkiest people we'd ever spoken to. The attached restaurants are also very good. We enjoyed several meals there and never had anything bad to eat. Business center was available 24 hours a day and free. Hotel wifi in our room was a bit expensive, but we're used to that in hotels all over the world. Taxis were called promptly. We did not try the pool on the roof. It looked small but clean. The staff were incredible. They knew our names, and also understood (without us telling them) that we would be returning to the hotel in a week for one additional night prior to our flight out of Sydney and asked (without any prompting) if there was anything we wished to leave behind in secure storage until our return. We can't wait to return to the hotel. It is lovely without being snooty. It will feel like home. A very posh home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Helen J
Reviews.Content: The concierge Cameron Griffin works wonders. The entire staff is most gracious and professional. Request a room with a view of the opera house. And try to see something there or at the nearby Sydney Theatre Co.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: 10StarDeluxe
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and pleasure and always stay in 5 star deluxe hotels, and this is by far is one of the best hotels I have experienced. I stayed here with a friend for 10 nights over the New Year celebrations as part of an 8 week round the world trip. All the hotels we stayed at were 5 star+ (we stayed at 18 in total). Everything about this hotel was great â€“ the location, the views, the rooms plus the staff and management were wonderful. They always greeted us by name and nothing was too much trouble. Needless to say the service was impeccable; it was warm and friendly but not intrusive and always very professional. The concierge, the manager of the bar restaurant and the assistant manager I would like to mention, but all were fantastic. We ate in the hotel restaurants often and found the food and service excellent. The hotel has a great location on the water in front of the Opera House and next to the Harbour Bridge. It is in a trendy and upscale part of town and is within easy walking distance to many shops, restaurants and bars. Plus it has a great arts and crafts market on Saturdays right on its doorstep. We stayed in a very nice room with an Opera House view, and boy what a view â€“ the best in Sydney. It had a good sized bathroom and a great balcony overlooking the bay with that great view with a front row seat to the New Years celebration. We sat and watched all the preparation for News Years Eve on our balcony and that evening we celebrated it at the hotels rooftop party â€“ it was unbelievable. You are so close to the fireworks you really soak-in the atmosphere, plus those firework displays that are simply breathtaking. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and we have booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Park Hyatt Sydney during out trip to New Zealand and Australia...The hotel was full over New Year's weekend so we initially stayed at the Shangri-La which was very nice and had a great view...That being said, it was large and impersonal...The Park Hyatt had a different feel...It was located on the edge of Sydney Harbor and has a direct view of the Sydney Opera House...It is a small hotel in comparison to the Shangri-La and the Four Seasons and is much more personal...We had a room with a balcony that overlooked the harbor and the Opera House...The hotel and rooms were finished in a modern/minimalist style...The breakfast was very tasty and was served in a restaurant with a great view of the harbor....My only minor criticism of the hotel is that some of the staff were a bit over-serious and too cool for school...Additionally, the hotel is great but was twice as expensive as the Shangri-La...It was great but I don't know if it was worth twice the money...During our stay we ate at Rockpool, Quay and Tetsuya's...Tetsuya's was as good as advertsied, Rockpool was surprisingly good and Quay was a bit overrated...Sydney is perhaps my favorite city in the world and the Park Hyatt is unquestionably the best hotel in the city and worth the extra money if you are looking for a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Oustanding, Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: freqtravellersfour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas and we wish we had booked a longer stay. We had a completely flawless stay. The service at the Park Hyatt Sydney is probably the best we've ever experienced. One manager in the restaurant "Lucas" took the time to tell us all about Australia and Sydney. He gave us some great advise and as a result, our whole trip was perfect. It didn't matter which staff member we talked to, they all took the time to help and say "yes". Even the valets outside the front door were polite, and helpful 100% of the time. We didn't have a single "no, I'm sorry..." the whole time we were there. All the rooms are beautifully appointed with breathtaking views. And the food is first rate. It's an expensive hotel but, as one other reviewer said, Why should it be? With such service, quality, and location, one would expect to pay for it. We have stayed in many many hotels all over the world, with and without our kids, and this was hands down the best experience yet. I would recommend it to anyone. Thank you Park Hyatt Sydney!! (**Just as an aside, we went to the Hyatt in MELBOURNE for a few days after Christmas, and it was total crap in every way. There is No comparison to be made whatsoever.)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnBAustralia
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here in November 2008. It was our 26th Wedding Anniversary so we were looking for something special. We chose an Opera King Room which was lovely. Because it was our Anniversary we were given a complimentary bottle of Sparkling Wine which was very much appreciated. Breakfast was included in the our package. and it was very good. We don't normally order room service when we stay in hotels, but on the night of our Wedding Anniversary we decided to treat ourselves to dinner in our room. We are very glad we did as the food was great and the meal was very well presented. We found the staff to very effiecient and approachable. This Hotel although pricey is value for Money. And for a special occassion with a wonderful view I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best View in the World!”
Reviews.Author: bobbinuk
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. We stayed here on the second leg of our Honeymoon and the hotel staff made everything run so smoothly with a personal service, you didnâ€™t feel like another number. Our room was amazing and we looked out directly over the harbour onto the Sydney Opera House, It was that close I felt that I could touch it! As a great lover of Sydney I could not have asked for anything else. The bathroom was in keeping with the luxury of the hotel with some lovely toiletries and the power shower was wonderful for staving off the jet lag! Everything about the hotel was run beautifully and the breakfast was cooked to order perfectly. The location is fantastic for getting around and about and it took no time to walk across and round the area of The Rocks to the Botanical Gardens. On the downside it is very expensive, even though itâ€™s a fabulous place I think you are paying for the location primarily and some of the cheaper views donâ€™t have the view we had, I only wish we could afford to stay there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Park Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: BFD
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Park Hyatt on a number of occasions and have always loved it. Big comfortable rooms, very warm reception, great breakfasts, big marble bathrooms, great views, and great location. One of the best places in Sydney to simply wind down and relax. I can vouch for the absolute pleasure of a single malt scotch in the bar of an evening in the olde world atmosphere. NIce to be able to park the car at the hotel when you arrive, and not use it again until you leave, as the hotel is central to the city, and walking around the foreshore is a pleasure. Can't recommend it highly enought to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Best service and location in town!”
Reviews.Author: NuBrain
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November for 4 nights, after checking out from Quay West Suites (see review). The whole Park Hyatt experience starts from the moment you arrive until you leave. Check in quick and efficient, any changes/amendments to the booking were made on the spot and with instant confirmation. Concierge (Cameron) was one of the best I've dealt with, accommodating any single request or answering any questions always with a nice smile. He even recommended me to his counterpart in Melbourne, as that was the next leg of my trip. Rooms were very well decorated and spacious, great bathrooms and walk-in closets. Didn't make use of the restaurants but the bar, views were unbeatable and it has a decent cocktail list. Small pool but the views from the deck and jacuzzi will stay in your head for a long time...where else can you be a in a hot tub facing the Opera House?

Reviews.Title: “Living in Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow03
Reviews.Content: Having return from overseas stay for 7 nights at the Park Hyatt was amazing memory . Our room has magnificent view of Sydney Harbour and the Rock area . Front Desk very helpful, the breakfast over looking Sydney Harbour was just magnificent my wife ordering waffles and strawberry everyday. The hotel its self very close to the Rocks which in our opinion is outstanding area of Sydney.The Restaurants within walking distance are top class, we order some food from room service the food very good. We even impress with remote control curtains and blinds. One night there was a on the Harbour a fire works displays that was magic and add memorable to our trips.If you are seeking luxury this is the outstanding Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Worth Breaking the Bank”
Reviews.Author: Mayfair Ranger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in an â€œOpera Kingâ€� room at the Park Hyatt in early October. The Opera King (or Twin) is the basic category of room enjoying a direct, unobstructed view of the Opera House, but I reckon that some of the cheaper (or should I say less expensive?) rooms enjoy a serviceable, albeit not front-on, view also. Quite apart from the views, however, the location of this property is absolutely superb - probably the most perfectly sited hotel in which we have ever stayed, anywhere. Want to do the bridge walk? Itâ€™s five minutes away. Likewise Circular Quay. The proximity of the Opera House itself is self-evident, etc. etc. If you also select a basic room, bear in mind that some rooms have proper balconies with chairs, while others have much smaller balconies without chairs (even though the rooms appear to be of an almost identical size) - itâ€™s therefore worth requesting a room with a proper balcony with chairs. The rooms are well-sized, with desk space, plus with extremely comfortable large beds and pillows. The bed linen is also top notch. The marble bathrooms are spacious, with a separate shower and good amenities. The soundproofing of the rooms is excellent, but one curious feature is that the bathroom extractor fans do not turn off (they are not at all loud, but you know how it is when you notice a noise that will not go away). Management confirmed that this was a design feature. My other minor gripe with the room was that the internet service had to be paid for. For a property at this price-point, I consider this to be an unnecessary irritant - and Park Hyatts are not consistent in this regard. Breakfast (included in only some room rates) features a great selection, including many cooked-to-order items. Both hotel restaurants, situated with Opera House views, offer excellent quality of food and elegant presentation. On one occasion the lunchtime service was slow but it was a minor complaint and the place was busy. The hotel also has a cosy and comfortable whisky bar with an open fireplace (or at least my wife tells me it does - I was sufficiently sloshed not to remember). The Park Hyattâ€™s spa is a little disappointing, being both tiny and disjointed. Showers are on one floor and the sauna and steam room on another, making it a bit of an effort to cool off afterwards. Bell boys are super friendly and very quick to help with taxis, luggage etc. With the exception of a dim receptionist who allocated us a room with an inferior balcony, when the next door room with a large one was vacant, the overall quality and friendliness of staff was excellent. If you are willing to swallow the expenditure, I donâ€™t think youâ€™ll find a better option in Sydney than the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother ! How disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Whitefern
Reviews.Content: We have visited Sydney on a number of occassions and always promised we would treat ourselves to the Park Hyatt, overlooking the Opera House. What a disappointment! Hugely overpriced ($700+ per night RO) for what you get. I have stayed in other Hyatt hotels and assure you this is the WORST. Rooms are small and grubby and the service is dreadful. Even trying to get fresh milk and tea bags from Housekeeping was like getting blood from a stone. We all know hotel phone charges are high, but a $5 charge wether or not you actually make a connection?! $30 for internet connection! Its free in the cafe across the road in the Rocks. After an awful breakfast with dreadful service we tried a number of cafes in the Rocks, it was 1/4 the price, better and included freewire internet service. Best recommendation for breakfast id the Patisserie My advise.. try an independant hotel in the Rocks or even the Mantra hotel is better on Bond St.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 10!”
Reviews.Author: FGD23
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy luxury, impecable service, spacious rooms, location, and amazing views this hotel is for you. It does come with a price tag attached to it I must say. My wife and I had an amazing stay at this prime property in the best part of Sydney. Enjoy a glass of wine at the Harbour Bar while looking at the Opera House light up at sunset... priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, gorgeous, fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirkychat
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best hotel I have every stayed in. We booked a suite with a view of the Opera House and I was completely blown away by the views... just magnificent. And the room was so luxurious with everything you could possibly ask for. The service and friendliness of the staff was second to none, the food was excellent and the concierge we spoke to when we asked for help to get about and see the sights was so kind and attentive. I can't think of a single thing I could criticise - it was absolutely as perfect as it could possibly have been!!

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: MissyManila
Reviews.Content: actually this is my dream hotel... i like the location of this hotel, in the Rocks/ Circular Quay... facing the famous Sydney Opera House that i admire so much... the downfall, as expected is, its really expensive... sydney shangri-la hotel's price is more reasonable that this...can't imagine my husband will pay that much for my dream hotel... it's an experience that's worth keeping especially when i think about the price... definitely the luxury of life... staff members are not that friendly though... but the room and view are perfect...

Reviews.Title: “The best views of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: codobai
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location cannot be beaten. It's an easy walk to the train station at Circular Quay. The biggest selling point is the waterfront views. The cityscape, the Opera House, the Bridge, and the water are just picture-perfect from our balcony. It's worth every dollar. The unique thing is that although the hotel is in the midst of the tourist sites, it's quietly tucked away on a small lane. The only noise you'll hear is the boat traffic and the chimes from the clock tower but it's a pleasant one. Don't forget to visit he pool on the rooftop. The views from there under the night sky is absolutely spectacular! We would love to come back but it's a long flight from America!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JoeyAJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked into this hotel for a special occasion, and being Sydney locals we expected it to live up to our expectation of being the best hotel in the city. We stayed over the easter holiday and we were treated to an upgrade. The staff were charming and friendly - not overly engaging which suits us - but they were readily available when we needed them and the concierge arranged a booking in a hard-to-get restaurant. The hotel restaurant was terrific for lunch and quite good value- the Harbour Kitchen for breakfast is a simply stunning way to start your day. The room - an Opera suite- was contemporary and stylish and we had ample room for our several guests that visited.The location is without peer if you are after an iconic Sydney visit, with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge bursting into view at every opportunity. Great walks from here-with train and ferry a pleasant stroll away if you were so inclined. The hotel was frequented by visiting celebrities but the staff spent no more time with them than they did with us. We had a wonderful time and see the Hyatt as easily the best 5 star hotel in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Location....”
Reviews.Author: Garota05
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt is the place to stay if you're after a luxurious, beautiful hotel that is right on the harbour. In saying that, when you are paying $700 a night for a hotel room, I think that the internet should be free people!! My hubby used the internet for around 15 mins and we were charge $25 for it. The only other gripe I had was the breakfast. For $45, my poached eggs were completely hard and tasted only of vinegar - a little disappointing considering the price. In saying that, the perfect view of sydney harbour and the opera house while eating my hard vinegary eggs made it all ok. The rooms are big and the furniture is just lovely. The bathrooms are great and the electric curtains/shutters are awesome! I would definately recommend people who are after something special to stay here - there is nothing that compares to the location and the view...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great views!”
Reviews.Author: Missshopper
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location! We booked an Opera View room and we were not disappointed by the view! It is within walking distance to much dining and stores in the Rocks area. We felt very safe there at night walking around also. The room itself was nice but nothing out of the ordinary for the price ($700+ a night). You are paying for the view which we felt was worth it. I had written the hotel two letters ahead of time saying we were celebrating special occasions (our son's wedding in Australia, my birthday, and our anniversary) but they did nothing for us which most hotels will have something to honor this. I did write about this in my comments card and found an apology letter when I got home from the manager saying it wasn't on my reservation. This could not be true, unless someone did not record it, as I sent it twice and all the other hotels on our trip responded to this. As we had an early sightseeing tour one day and an early flight the next, we ordered room service which was on time but pricey. We also had a drink in their lounge which was very pricey ($18 a drink). I would chose this hotel again as I felt you cannot get a better view or location!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: oscar505
Reviews.Content: Even better than the location of the Park Hyatt Sydney is the service. The concierge staff was extraordinary in their efforts to meet any request and provide any service, including giving minor first aid to our scared toddler. They secured a private driver for us, recommended restaurants, gave helpful transportation advice and helped in many ways. The rooms were very good, looking out at the Circular Quay and (from the balcony) the Opera House. I enjoyed just watching the light change on the view by the hour. And the location, tucked under the base of the Harbor Bridge, at the edge of The Rocks, gives quick access to restaurants, shopping, water taxis, ferries and walks on or across the bridge. Only small nits: the connecting doors between our rooms could not be unlocked, so gave us the potential of having kids locked in one room and adults in another if they inadvertently closed the door - which they did once! The hotel restaurant's breakfast was good, but other meals and room service offered sort of ho-hum choices. But the proximity to other good food made this less of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great position”
Reviews.Author: salbags
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Opera House, harbour view room for 2 nights when we first arrived in Sydney and it was definitely worth it for the position and the views. The pool is very dissapointing as it loses the sun early and it would have been nice to have relaxed by the pool in the late afternoon. Also it was not clean and there was no drink service. We did not eat in the hotel as it is surrounded by fantastic restaurant bars and cafe's at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “loved the room & service/butler/ housemaid”
Reviews.Author: delphis1
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days/ 2 nights in sydney, had the premier suite and an adjoining room, the rooms are beautiful. The butler service and room service were fantastic. However on our first night we ordered in-room service to which we had to send the childrens meals back as they werent cooked properly, our meals were average but cold, we then ordered our breakfast being 3x full harbourkitchen breakfasts which were missing fruit salad. on the 3day we ordered another 2x breakfasts of the same as prior, we got our fruit salads but the hot breakfast wasnt hot at all. So the stay was fantastic just the food was a disappointment to us all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DeeMooner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon. On arrival we experienced the same great personalised check in as other reviewers, and were shown to our deluxe opera king room, which had a great balcony which looked directly onto the opera house. No amount of money could buy such a great view! A few moments later, we were given a bottle of champagne, which we enjoyed on our balcony and then on the roof, where we sat in the sun and swimmed. Breakfast in the morning was enjoyed on our balcony - great Vanilla/Blueberry pancakes! Would thoroughly reccommend this hotel to anyone - it is by location and service seemingly one of the best in Sydney, if not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: bigbird01
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the best location in Sydney. You wake up in the morning and open the window and you have the opera house looking back at you. I was lucky enough to have a clear view but some rooms don't. This is a good hotel and i want to give it 5 stars but i can't. The service was good, the food was good but the place lacked any real atmosphere. Also the premium you are paying for it's location is quite high. The room was very modern and quite trendy, nice Lcd Tv, great bathroom, everything you would expect. The SPA is not really a SPA is has some treatmnents and a nice plunge pool on the roof. While this was nice it did not feel 5 star, and it had a slightly forgoten feel to it. Overall: best location in Sydney, good rooms, good service but not worth the premium you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous except for the cooling”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in January. we had an opera house view room & the view was superb. the bed was good - furniture very comfortable & the bathroom huge if a little dated. house keeping was good. the food in the restaurant & the views from the restaurant were both fabulous. our only gripe was that the air con wasn't working when we arrived - we later heard it had been out for 24hrs. we were not warned it wasn't working when we arrived. infact we were shown how to use it & told it took a while to work ! 5hrs in to our stay when we rang to complain about how hot our room was we were told the air con was temporarily down but engineers were repairing it. 8hrs in to our stay it was still not working - we asked & got a fan. 24hrs in to our stay we called the duty manager to ask for a progress report. he or she did not speak to us but let his/her secretary deal with us. we learnt that the air con would not be up and running till after we'd left the hotel. when we asked for compensation we were referred to reception who were very helpful. this was all handled badly. i don't expect to be mislead by a hotel of this quality when i'm paying such a lot of money and i also expect the duty manager to have the courtesy of dealing with me when there is a real problem with how the hotel is running.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay Except for One Annoyance”
Reviews.Author: boston6_8guy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our last night in Sydney, as part of our honeymoon. I must say I have never seen a more beautiful and luxurious hotel, in all of my travels. The location is to die for, and the staff are incredibly nice and attentive. I almost fell over when the reception agent walked us to our room, and made sure everything was to our liking. An incredible hotel, a gorgeous room, and a stunning bathroom without a doubt. And, the automatic shades were cool, but didn't close 100% (and you can't move them by hand.) BUT, there was one REALLY annoying thing, that totally knocked one "owl face" off of my rating. They charged us $11 to make a 1.2 minute call to a local number. HELLO!? If people are paying over $500 a night for a hotel room, do you charge them to pick up the phone for 1.2 minutes, to call a friend in the same city? I was amazed at something so thoughtless/greedy/silly. So, I hope your stay is as great as ours, but stay away from the phones! Don't even look at 'em, or you may get some obnoxious charge! And, uh, the breakfast is $45 each. I don't know what they was serving, but it couldn't have been that delicious. The view, though, is unbelievable, with the sound of waves under the restaurant when the windows are open...

Reviews.Title: “Arrival in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: margykf
Reviews.Content: Sydney from London at Christmas time is not the easiest of trips! You are over tired and harassed by all those last minute jobs. But after a long and disturbed journey (a family with hacking coughs and small children in adjacent seats) it was an enormous joy to arrive at this excellent hotel. The welcome was efficient and peaceful and apart from a change of room, due to a previous occupant having been a big smoker, something I find unbelievable in this age, that someone would do to a glorious hotel room with a view to the Opera House across the water. We were given a delightful harbour view, large room with every calm comfort that you could want. The magic of the ferry boats crossing the harbour on an unusually wet and cloudy day have lulled our jet lagged bodies. The Park Hyatt offers a fantastic way to be introduced to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in a great loaction”
Reviews.Author: Longdrive
Reviews.Content: I had always yearned to stay at the Park Hyatt Sydney and at last I had accrued enough Hyatt Gold Passport points to book a room as a birthday treat. Booking in was a very easy experience and sitting at a desk in the lobby made you feel important. On checking in, the charming young lady inquired if we were celebrating any special occasion and on hearing that it was my birthday she had no hesitation in arranging for a nice bottle of champagne to be sent to our room. As I had secured the booking on points I was half expecting a room with a lesser view but we were blown away with both the room and the view of the Harbour and the Opera House. They also provided us with vouchers for a welcome drink in the hotel bar which was also appreciated. We did not eat at the hotel as there are any number of quality restaurants within minutes walk all providing great food and matching views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. My only negative of the room was that I considered the bed to be a touch hard for my liking but I still managed to have a good nights rest. The electric curtains were a nice touch as we didn't have to get out of bed to open up the magnificent view of the Opera House in the morning. All staff in the hotel were friendly and obliging. As the regular room tariff for the hotel is $700+ , the biggest test is, would I pay that much to stay there or is there better value quality hotels in Sydney. To put this question to the test we checked out after one night and checked into the Shangri La which is about 600 metres away.

Reviews.Title: “Under whelmed”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a city harbour view room. Donâ€™t be expecting the view shown on the website with this category of room. I had to lean over the railing and look to the left to see the Opera House. Loved the balcony and would of loved to sit out there but the seat cushions were soiled and the table was less than clean. The room itself was OK. Loved all the shelves. The lights in them do make the top surface warm so watch what you place on them. The automatic curtains would not close all the way. The light wood is pleasant but it shows every mar and scuff. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable I have experienced. I think the pillow topper was missing as it was very firm. Even our friends that came to our room made mention of it so I knew it was not just us. The bedside clock did not have a light so you could not tell the time after dark. Huge bathroom with great amenities. Slight mildew issue at the base of one of the glass walls in the shower. Toilet seat opening is quite large so beware. Some of the TV channels came in less than focused. Wonderful closet. Common areas were good with the exception of the area near the bar that smelled of stale smoke. The Staff are beyond wonderful! They are some of the best I have ever encountered. They along with the location are what make this hotel. If you put the building anywhere else it would not command such a price.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: teambloopy
Reviews.Content: We spent the first two nights of our honeymoon here and loved every secd. Great location, great views, beautiful room and staff willing to do anything possible to help. We were given a bottle of champagne, strawberries and chocolates to start our wedding night off in a most romantic way which was a nice touch. Not something we could afford to do regularly but certainly worth it for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - unbeatable location & great staff”
Reviews.Author: gully1
Reviews.Content: My wife Chrissy & I stayed twice at the Sydney Park Hyatt on our recent holiday to Australia arriving on 5th July to the 10th of July and 1 last night of the 17th of July. The holiday was to get off to a bad start at London Heathrow with the cancellation of our flight on the 3rd July due to a security scare, BA managed to get us on a Qantas flight the next day but despite flying â€œFirstâ€� we spent the first night in Terminal 4 Baggage Reclaim vainly trying to recover our baggage. On arrival at Sydney we were advised the luggage was not on board. Imagine our horror in that we were arriving the evening of the 5th July to the Sydney Park Hyatt in clothes that we had worn for 2 days already. My wife Chrissy and I have nothing but admiration for everyone at the Park Hyatt in that we were greeted warmly and the Concierge Team of Cameron, Chris, Andrew & Patrick swung into action immediately day & night seemingly chasing our baggage through Qantas Baggage Services. All the way through our stay we were addressed with our names without prompting & after 4 days in Sydney my wife Chrissy was reunited with her luggage. Needless to say that the Concierge Team never gave up chasing my luggage & despite moving on to Lilianfels in the Blue Mountains for 2 nights & The Beach Club in Hamilton Island for 5 nights. On our return to the Park Hyatt we were greeted with an immediate update on my baggage status from Cameron in Concierge. Never before in our stays in hotels of all standing has my wife or I experienced customer satisfaction & attention to detail as shown by these guys. As to the hotel itself, the bell hops are very dutiful & attentive, greeting us by name on both initial greetings & subsequent greetings during the stay. They were very prepared to organise a taxi which was a past reviewers concern. Daniel on reception initially checked us in with a relaxed but efficient style that was very much appreciated after what we had endured the previous few days. We were shown to our Opera King Deluxe Room 212 which definitely had the wow factor, Daniel showed us round the room facilities finally retracting the main curtains and sheer drapes electronically revealling the signature view of the Opera House, fantastic. The bed must have been 7 foot wide & it was extremely comfortable, supportive & good for your back, it was without doubt best bed we had in Ozzie. It was nice to wake up, turn over & take in the view from the bed viewing through both patio doors as the Opera King Deluxe Rooms have 2 patio doors & balconies. Breakfast is taken in the main restaurant with views overlooking the Circular Quay & the Opera House, on weekends a buffet is provided, on weekdays hot meals are waiter service. A good choice is also available in cereals, fresh fruits, danish pastries, croissants & toasted bread of various kind plus cheeses & hams & fruit juices. Restaurant manager Lucinda oversees the restaurant extremely well catering both business people & holidaymakers. Lunch & Dinner in the hotel provide an excellent array of choices including vegetarian options which if for some reason other choices are required Lucinda or the Concierge Team are only too happy to discuss on your behalf with the chef. The rooftop pool in spring, summer & autumn time provides a pleasant location to cool down & unwind with bridge views, although in winter the temperatures may prove too challenging, it was for us anyway? The spa provides all year round facilities & is located in the roof top area. It should be appreciated that July 2007 has provided the coldest winter month for NSW & Queensland for many years, our time at Hamilton Island was affected by colder than usual weather also. General Manager Marlene Poynder can be congratulated for running an exceptional hotel; her management style certainly seems to get the best out of her management team & staff alike. She can be found most mornings in the breakfast room talking to clients & reviewing facilities, she is a lovely lady. Our time at the Sydney Park Hyatt was above expectation & on both stays in the holiday (we returned for 1 last night immediately before returning home); without doubt we would return to this hotel again when we are next in Sydney. We would also look to have the Opera King Deluxe rooms again as these do seem to have the best views & square footage per AUD.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely top notch in every wat”
Reviews.Author: littllebabyneko
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay here for our wedding night and I'm glad to say that it was perfection. We got a Opera View room and were allowed to check in an hour early so that everyone could get their hair and makeup done (although they would not commit to this until that morning which added a bit of nerves). The room itself was an Opera View room with a lovely view of the Opera House. I am very particular with my hotel rooms but I can honestly say that this was perfectly appointed with everything I could ever want! The bathroom was huge and had a separate bath and there was a sizeable walk in closet where I could hang up my wedding gown. The leather chair with foot stool was gorgeous (I really wanted one for myself, I saw one for $4,000 at David Jones) and the TV had a great selection of channels. Rooms are very well soundproofed which helps on a Saturday night when people walk past the hotel. When we came back from our reception at midnight we were greeted with Lindor balls, strawberries and sparkling wine. The next morning we awoke for the breakfast and if I can be critical, this was a smaller selection of breakfast goodies than I have previously seen at other breakfast buffets. The food was a little disappointing and the fruit was quite unripe and hard. I've actually had a wide standard of meals at the Park Hyatt from hideous (think Deb instant mash and microwaved thawed meat) to sublime (the Good Good Month dessert menu). Other than that, the Park Hyatt has wonderfully accomodating service and the rooms are absolutely top notch with stunning views and the best Sydney has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo!”
Reviews.Author: W0zza
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Sydney in May 2007 and would recommend this Hotel. This is a thoroughly modern, luxurious, business hotel with spacious rooms & tastefully furnished decor - in a fantastic location. Views from some of the rooms of the Opera house, the Harbour, Bridge and downtown are unbeatable especially if you are lucky weatherwise. Very conveniently located within walking distance of a huge array of pubs, clubs, restaurants and downtown. Staff service is outstanding and did meet quite a few of the management team during my short stay. Arrived early at the hotel desperately needing a shower before heading straight to a meeting â€“ and was pleasantly surprised! Not only was the room ready but the hotel team had taken the trouble to prepare breakfast â€“ served in the room! Compliments to Mr. Fredrik Harfors & his teamâ€¦.How I wish this could be replicated elsewhere in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to end a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Venus2
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel after spending three weeks traveling in Australia . We really enjoyed the Park Hyatt with the spectacular views of the Opera House. We took many photos. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was roomy. The staff was friendly and their assistance was very helpful when we had trouble playing the DVD player. We would definitely stay here again. It was a great end to a beautiful vacation in a wonderful country.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: grm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in April at the beginning of a month long visit to Australia. The hotel has stunning views of the Opera House and is connected to nearby harbor attractions by a promenade at the hotel's front door. The rooms are very very nice. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyinSeoul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights - the first two of our honeymoon in australia and it was everything we hoped it would be. We arrived early (7am) and although a room wasn't ready for us we were able to shower and change in the spa and left our luggage. They said they would call when our room was ready, which they did at about 11am. We found the service to be very good and we were given a comlimentary bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. Our room was spacious with a great view of the Opera House. The bathroom was one of the best that we have had in a hotel room. We had no problem in getting a taxi from outside the hotel, even at 8.30am to get back to airport. The door staff were very helpful and the concierege good in recommending a restaurant. The only negative comment was the price - although it is a wonderful hotel in the best location I do not think it justifies the prices charged, if it was not for it being our honeymoon we could not have justified the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad In Quick Succession”
Reviews.Author: Big_Blue_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt was our landing point in Australia and also where we returned for one night after a trip to the Blue Mountains and it was almost very good indeed. We first arrived late and tired after 24 hours travelling from the UK and were efficiently and courteously welcomed and shown to our room. Opening the curtains after dark showed why the Hyatt charges a premium, even for Sydney. We had a Opera King and right there in front of us was the floodlit Opera House, a fantastic view. The Hotel is well situated for most things you would want in Sydney and has all the right facilities - free internet (for first 30 mins although no one seemed to be checking) business like staff, a decent restaurant with great views etc, and the rooms are good sized and pretty well equipped. We ate there one night and the meal was pretty good, although there was a bit of a wait between courses. To the staff's credit they picked this up and offered us complementary wine. The buffet breakfast is a little thin for the price - we headed for the Gum Nut Cafe on the second day - much better! We left thinking it was close to a 5. However, when we returned, things were not so great. As we were only staying one night and had an early start we only booked a City/Harbour view room, but were horrified to find ourselves in a room at the far end of the hotel with a view of a tree and a cafe kitchen. We expressed our views to the reception person who said she would look into it. We felt that for a hotel that trades on views the lack of any view from this one should have attracted some reduction. After 20 minutes of no response we headed back to reception to try and track her down - and ended up being handled by the overall Room Director as the original receptionist seemed to have disappeared. He arranged for us to move to a more central room with a view of Circular Quay and admitted that the room we had originally been allocated was often heavily discounted and complained about. However, the service did not really improve as the original girl re-appeared and asked if we would be moving our own bags along - no offer of a bell boy. With hindsight (and denied by the Room Director) we believe we got the duff room as we were checking out very early (6.30 for a flight to Uluru) after just one night and it was also the Bridge Birthday weekend, but the room we were given certainly could not really be called a room with a view. Overall, the Hyatt has got a great location, good facilities, some good staff and a high level of style. However, it was all rather impersonal and business orientated which for a hotel right on Sydney Harbour was slightly at odds with the location etc. If you want the best views in Sydney, and go for a minimum of an Opera view room - you will be fine, if poor! But don't expect a very intimate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service BEFORE even staying there!”
Reviews.Author: lhapsie
Reviews.Content: On March 7 (12noon Sydney time) I faxed the hotel directly trying to get a special group reservation. My friend had special rates for guests attending his wedding. On March 8 (12noon Sydney time again), no response from the hotel, so I faxed them again. On March 9, no response from the hotel, so I called the hotel's reservations directly. Deanna (in reservations) said she did not see any faxes or reservation & told me that there was no information for wedding party rooms. However, we know for a fact that the person getting married HAS bought out most of the hotel from 4/18-4/22! I will be sending the General Mgr of the hotel a letter informing her of her hotel's shoddy (or lack of ) service. This could be an indication of bigger problems with frontline operations & service. (Ms.)Theo Fujiyoshi - Associated Travel-Honolulu, Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Merchant
Reviews.Content: This is a classic example of the best of times or the worst of times. The rack rate of AU$600 per night we paid for a "Park King" is in my long experience of hotel staying the biggest ripoff ever. A glorious location for a hotel where having paid AUS$600 for an early check in we were shown to a room that can only be described as a dungeon. A small window with an upward view of the Harbour Bridge. After complaining that this was totally depressing we were offered a room at the end of the long building that had a window looking at a tree and the street below. One could only envy those lucky guests who would enjoy the prettiest view in all of Sydney. A word of warning to all.. do not pay this kind of money for an ordinary hotel room just because your neighbors are enjoying themselves. Check out time is a ridiculous 11AM. An offer to stay until 13:00 was made for a charge of AU$130! Only after our frustration was made palpable did the same receptionist finally offer a later check out, "complimentary." The nicest gesture made in 4 nights. Staff were polite if imperious. A sense of importance filled the air apart from the poor scum like us who had to hike to the far end of the hotel to our sad rooms. Probably the longest corridor in the western world being served by only one elevator!The price here compared to The Four Seasons is ludicrous. The restaurant/bar food was disgraceful as was the service. I had wanted to stay at this hotel for years. I regret having done so and strongly urge any potential guests to clarify completely the location and view of the room before putting down the hefty price for a room in this much overrated hotel. I am sure it can be glorious here if one is lucky enough to have the chips fall in the right place. They did not for us and we shall never return.

Reviews.Title: “Style & Substance”
Reviews.Author: NickBB
Reviews.Content: I have read some bad reviews on TA but it was excellent. Very professional and stylish. Good facilities, excellent service and a wonderful restaurant which I enjoyed over three days. Most of all, such amazing views in the best location of Sydney in a small, stylish hotel.(on the Rocks). Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For New Year's Eve!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLosGatos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December for 7 nights. My husband is a Diamond Gold Passport member, so we used his points to get 2 rooms for the week. When we arrived, we were greeted by the door man, who was very nice! The woman who checked us in was great and even came to our rooms to show us around. She also included 2 Continental Breakfasts per room at no charge (a $160.00 AUD per day value) which we greatly appreciated. The rooms we had were on the first floor. For the Hyatt points the only choice was the City/Harbour views,which are beautiful, but one of our rooms also had a great view of the Opera House as well. The rooms are good sized with a large bathroom, and nicely decorated. As I was unpacking, I noticed the glass on the table next to the bed was VERY DIRTY with glass stains as well as some kind of sticky substance. This was also the case on the table next to the chair by the mirror, although this one was much dirtier! I cleaned the night stand table, but for curiosity, decided to not clean the table next to the chair. I wanted to see if the housekeeper in the morning cleaned it.. To our surprise she did not. This went on for several days. I told my family that the first housekeeper to clean this table we would give a $20 tip as well as inform the management of what a good employee this person was. Unfortunately, after 5 nights, no one did and my daughter could not take it any longer, so she cleaned it herself because she did not want it dirty when we celebrated New Year's Eve that night. The room service was great and the continental breakfast had a decent variety. The staff in the restaurant was hit and miss, however, there was one that especially terrific! We were lucky to get him as our waiter on New Years Eve Dinner! Also, one of the managers in the morning was great! We tried twice to have dinner at the hotel (not including New Years Eve), but one night no one would even acknowlege us (even after standing there for over 10 miuntes).On the night of the first of January, a nice woman greeted us . She told us that she did not have room in the restaurant, but if we did not mind waiting, we could have dinner in the bar. She told us to talk with the gentleman with dark black glassest there (she told us his name, but I can't remember it except that it started with a F). We approached him and when I repeated what she said, he RUDELY told us he had no room for us and tried to get us away from his area. On both of those nights we went to a nearby places to eat, which were EXCELLENT! Most dinners for five ran around $200AUD, but since the food was good, we did not mind spending the money. My daughter got sick one night and we called the hotel doctor. He recommended us to take her to a hospital called St Vincent. The only problem was that the hospital he told us to take her was for adults only (my husband told him she was ten years old). The hotel staff at the front desk, the door greeters, and the concierge were GREAT! Nicole the New Years Eve planner was wonderful! If you are in Sydney for New Years Eve, this is DEFINITELY the place to stay. The location is great!! We had dinner in the restaurant, which by the way was fantastic! After dinner we wanted to watch the 9pm fireworks, but were worried about the crowds, because the Rocks where the hotel is located is one of the best areas to see the fireworks. To our great surprise, the hotel blocks off the area in front of it to only hotel guests or people having dinner there. We had a fantastic view of the fireworks. It is so hard to describe how beautiful the fireworks were, especially the ones at midnightl. From the hotel, we were able to see the fireworks over Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, as well as fireworks coming from what appeared out of the buildings in downtown Sydney. If we came back here, I would stay for New Years whether we used Hyatt points or had to pay, because the experience is well worth it. If it were not for the POOR HOUSEKEEPING and INCONSISTENT RESTAURANT STAFF I would give this hotel a 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not quite good enough”
Reviews.Author: Prufreck
Reviews.Content: For a hotel of this calibre, not to mention price, we were disappointed with several aspects of our stay. The location and view may be inspiring from the guest rooms, but try getting a cab at any time of the day or night and the doorman will advise you to 'walk up the road and try at the Four Seasons; taxis don't like coming here!' Not a great recommendation for a five-star hotel, especially if you are wearing high heels. Our pre-booked morning newspaper failed to materialise and took 45 minutes to resolve; a pre-booked and much-needed massage appointment at the Spa was messed up and we were simply advised to 'come back later'. And the parting gift was an additional $75 bill, sent by mail, because the housekeeping staff had incorrectly tallied our minibar account. All in all it was a thoroughly ordinary experience, despite the view of the Opera House. If you are contemplating a stay at this hotel, consider the Four Seasons instead (where I have also stayed and had much better service)!

Reviews.Title: “Haughty reception, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kateapple
Reviews.Content: We're currently staying at the Park Hyatt Sydney. Our room (King with a view of the Opera House) wasn't available at 3pm check-in, so the receptionist invited us to have a snack in their restaurant for 20 minutes. She offered to pay for the snack and get us when the room was available. An hour later, the room was still unavailable - and the new person at reception said that we would need to pay for our tea and scones. The room is nothing special. The bath is cramped and outdated. The bellstaff are terrific -- but the rest of the staff need to be retrained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Emma676
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights - the hotel is in a beautiful location on Sydney harbour within walking distance of shops and restaurants in the Rocks. The rooms are well appointed with lovely bathroom and a balcony overlooking the harbour. The staff were very helpfull, the food excellent. The bar serves the best Caipirinha outside Brazil! Would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: snow1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this Park Hyatt for 5 nights and loved it! The location simply could not be better. The service and concierge was outstanding and the food at the Harbour Lounge Bar and Grill (hotel restaurant) is incredibly fresh, creative and delicious. Our room (Opera King Deluxe) was very spacious with 2 balconies, sliding glass doors and a postcard worthy view of the harbor and Opera House. It was hard to leave the room. This is a fantastic urban hotel. I have traveled the globe and my husband and I both agree this is one of our favorite city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: newspro
Reviews.Content: We booked accommodations here based on recommendations from fellow travelers. There's no doubt that the Park Hyatt enjoys the best location in Sydney. It's why you book your admittedly expensive room here. After leaving through the hotel's rear door you're just steps away from some of Sydney's finest restaurants. And within sight and a short walk away, you'll find the handy Sydney ferries and a rail station at Circular Quay. Our king room, while not exuding the pure luxury of some other Park Hyatt properties inclduing their hotel in Tokyo, was good sized and comfortable although a bit dated. We really enjoyed the balcony with views of the world famous Sydney Opera House. With so many nearby local dining options we did not try the Hyatt's restaurant for dinner. We did have breakfast there one morning but it is pretty steep. $40 Australian for a continental and if you'd like made-to-order eggs with your meal, add another $5. We highly recommend a stay here and certainly enjoyed our five day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, totally up to date”
Reviews.Author: kingsroadgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a little trepidation, because I was concerned that the hotel perhaps was just resting on its laurels. It has the most fantastic location in Sydney, but would the rooms live up to their high price??? I was really impressed. We stayed in the Opera King Deluxe room, a huge room with a stunning view over the Opera House. The room was really well equipped with an enormous king bed and fabulous bedding. What luxury to go to bed with that Opera House view every night. I felt truly lucky. The room was always well-stocked, and the bathroom was large and luxurious (and I am picky about bathrooms!!) The food at the hotel is great. Definitely try to go for a rate where breakfast is included. Normally, the breakfast costs $40 AUD per person, and even at that price it is worth it. It is only a continental breakfast, but it is delicious. Lots of cheese, wonderful breads, and even a berry custard which tasted lovely for breakfast. All of this in a serene room with a great view over the harbor, and the lovely Opera House. I loved starting my day there. Room service was also wonderful, and the food quality was high. Using the computer at the business centre in the hotel was not cheap, but was worth it. It was quiet and private for any personal matters I needed to take care of. I loved this hotel, and will definitely return. Only complaints - we had a bodyguard sitting in the hall near our room for some VIP's on the floor (don't know who). It was tiring always having to greet this guy, night and day. Also, our bill was quite a mess, with all sorts of incorrect charges, due to our having booked this through AMEX Fine Hotels and Resorts where there were some freebies that were not handled properly.. It took a while to sort through, but in the end was resolved satisfactorily. This is the only place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the 80'S”
Reviews.Author: westender
Reviews.Content: This is a bad five star hotel and I sincerely rccommend that you don't stay there. If it wasn't for the views then this hotel would not rank so highly. The hallways and rooms are like industrial units. I always rate service above decor and this place has just about the worst i've experienced (for the money). The Hyatt is a souless building run by flashy young things with too much responsibility. If we had our our time again we would stay at the Observatory or Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “When In Sydney, You Must”
Reviews.Author: mikie12
Reviews.Content: There may be more glamorous hotels in the world, but for all around comfort and location, the Park Hyatt Sydney cannot be improved upon. We have stayed in many stunning hotels, but there is something so captivating about this property, that although it is expensive, it is well worth the outlay. . Some years ago we were visiting Hawaii, and met some people that did a great deal of traveling for business. I remember being told that the Park Hyatt Sydney had a remote control to open the drapes while you were still in your bed. Crazy as it seems, that always stuck in my mind, and when we were going to be spending ten days in Sydney, I knew that was the place we had to stay. The Park Hyatt is in a great location in The Rocks area of Sydney. It is located right on the water of the harbor, positioned with perfect views of the Sydney Opera House, and walking distance to Circular Quay and most all points of interest. There are many fine restaurants just out the door facing the Quay. You will find restaurants serving everything from Italian, seafood, and Chinese food. No matter what you are looking for, this hotel is so convenient, it makes it the ultimate spot. The hotel is not a large one with just 160 rooms and suites ranging up to over 1200 square feet. The design of the building is curved, located at the edge of the Harbor Bridge. There is no doubt that it was shaped to fit into the scenery without being flashy. There is nothing about this hotel that is tasteless. It is simple elegance at its best. The lobby is total class! It is basically uncomplicated, all windows, marble floors and lovely artwork. It took just a short time to get checked in, as we were already reserved for 10 days. We had a standard room and were extraordinarily delighted with our accommodations. The room was about 450 square feet with a balcony overlooking the Quay and a pleasant panorama of the Opera House. The rooms are very luxurious with a king bed complete with all white linens, goose down duvet, and silk pillows and matching dust ruffle. It almost had an Egyptian feeling. The wall looking out on the deck is all glass. These are amazing because although it is quite busy in that area, you cannot hear a thing when the doors are closed. They are all double doors with double panes. Trust me, it is as quiet as you could imagine. We had a contemporary desk, large television, overstuffed chair, and Internet service in the room. Everything was simple and perfect. The closet was not just any closet, but probably the best one I have seen in a hotel. Not only was it a walk-in, but there were drawers, multiple shelves, and all kinds of places to put your things. The bathroom was very generous in size and amenities. It was all marble, had a glass shower, and a very big separate bathtub. The vanity was designed with two marble sinks and numerous drawers to stash all your cosmetics. Of course there was a hair dryer, plush robes, and tons of fluffy white towels. The amenities were the best lotions, shampoo, soaps, and of course even an emery board was included. Nothing was missing in this bathroom. The dining room is called The Harbor Kitchen And Bar. It has won many awards and the food is excellent. Everything is a la Carte, so it can get expensive. We ate breakfast there a few times, and dinner a couple of nights, but there are so many places to eat in Sydney we didnâ€™t want to just eat at the hotel. One very interesting thing about this dining room is it is right on the waterfront. Again, the glass theme continues, and the windows actually pull up so you have a feeling of being outdoors. There is also an intimate bar on the main floor. There is an excellent exercise facility, and the pool is on the roof. We enjoyed going to the pool, as it was usually not crowded and very cozy. You had the feeling you were in a place that few had visited. I love this hotel, and actually hated to leave. I find that this is the benchmark of all hotels we stay in. Although I have stayed in some that are fancier, this one takes the cake for class, but not snobby. The staff is friendly and we felt we were not so much in a hotel, but a home. The Park Hyatt in Sydney is an example of what a luxury hotel should be! And yes, there was a remote control for the drapes!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient”
Reviews.Author: CuzICan
Reviews.Content: Truly an exceptional property with the views being the strongest draw. Our room was on the 3rd level in the middle of the hotel and upon opening my eyes in bed , opening the curtains, there was the fabulous Opera House in full majestic view, so close it almost looked like I could reach out and touch it. We were in Sydney for the recent short hail storm and the sky before the storm was a multi-color hue of blues and oranges reflecting around the Opera House, just fabulous. The rooms are nice, elegant with marble baths and modern furnishings. We had 3 in the Opera View king and it was a little small but for 2 would be perfect size. Refurbishing the exterior hallway carpet, or a good cleaning, is the only shortfall I saw. The staff were all helpful, friendly and welcoming. A short walk from wharf, CBD and many restaurants. Worth every dollar of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great hotel but make sure you get confirmation.”
Reviews.Author: Sydney2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt Sydney this weekend for my first anniversary. The hotel was in the most wonderful location. It was modern & very beautiful. Staff were exceptionally friendly & welcoming. We had a lovely weekend & didn't have to go far at all to enjoy the beauty of Sydney. An important note however please ensure you receive confirmation of your booking, including confirmation number, the room set-up and the view you are going to have. I originally booked the room through the internet. I printed off the confirmation page & was expecting an email confirmation as is common these days. After a few days of not receiving confirmation I called the hotel & was told I did not have a reservation. When I looked at the printout I realised that the panel on the right hand side of the page that had my confirmation details did not print. Only the main page did. I made another booking direct with the hotel (AU $50 a night more than the internet price) and was told that I was booked into a king room with a nice view. When I arrived on the weekend I was told by the concierge that we were in fact booked into a twin room. The only room with a King Bed was a Delux room. The hotel offered to upgrade us witha discount off the upgrade price but we still ended up paying AU150 an extra more a night. Being out first anniversary we took the upgrade. The room was very nice & we had a lovely view of the bridge & luna park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I would however also recommend that you have some confirmation of your reservation, room setup & view(note: rooms at the back of the hotel don't appear to have any view).

Reviews.Title: “memorable weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful time being tourists in our own town with a weekend stay at this lovely, low key hotel with stunning views and charming staff. Well worth the expense for a weekend we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate special occasion”
Reviews.Author: MissTravelAlot
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel septemer 2006. I had just sold my business, so wanted a special few days to celebrate. We statyed in an Opera King Deluxe Suite. It lived up to our expectations and beyond. If you want a view, this is the hotel. The rooms are great. The bathrooms are getting a little tatty there was some peeling wallpaper. But overall theyre marble and massive in size. The staff were beyond helpful without being intimidating. The only thing that didnt live up to the standard of the hotel was the day spa. They seem to have squashed it into some poky little rooms. Overall I would highly reccomend this hotel. The only one weve stayed in thats better is Versace on the gold coast.

Reviews.Title: “Understated, Classy, Unbeatable Location.”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our 6 year old son. The Rolling Stones had checked out a day or two before we arrived. Car transfer from airport worth every penny. The exterior of the hotel is low key almost to the point of dowdy; interiors understated, classy but a little faded. This Grande Dame could probably do with a bit of a makeover but the location is unbeatable and dripping in 'wow' factor. Our room had a direct view of the Opera House. Spacious and well-appointed with plenty of room for an extra single bed. Breakfast in the waterfront restaurant simple but delicious although at times the staff seemed to struggle a bit with the guest traffic (we were there over Easter and the hotel had full occupancy). A leisurely 20 minute stroll round to the Opera House and then on to The Botanic Gardens. 5 mins from Sydney Harbour Bridge. Ferries to the Zoo, Manly Beach and others en route to Opera House. Museum of Contemporay Arts (currently showing the Sam Taylor-Wood exhibition) a short stroll away. The Rocks market on a Saturday is behind the hotel. Fantastic bars and restaurants within moments of the front door. Rooftop pool small but perfectly formed and a great place for bat-spotting at dusk. Cannot recommend highly enough. May not apeal to high-fashion style seekers as low on glam factor but unbeatable choice for seeing the sights and very child friendly. Undeniably pricey. By the way, we did notice that there is a very good-looking Holiday Inn tucked in just behind the Park Hyatt - prob won't have the views but also a fantastic location for seeing all of the above and no doubt a lot less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star View”
Reviews.Author: Rocket88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt for 5 nights in March 2006 and here is what we observed: -There may be a nick or two in the furniture and it could use some exterior touch-up paint but make no mistake about it-this is truly a 5 star property. -The main reason you would stay here is the excellent location and the stunning knock-your-socks-off view of the harbour and Opera House. For this they get big bucks. But if you're not going to have a room with a view you would be better off staying somewhere else. -We stayed in balcony room 334 (top floor-level #4)and had a full straight-on view of the Opera House and a slightly-angled view of the downtown area. Most of the rooms to the left of room 333 (i.e. #332 down to about #300) have great city views but only a lateral view of the Opera House (everything over the hotel lobby is in this category) so if you want to sit on the balcony and take in the Opera House and the harbour views while having cocktails or pre-dinner snacks as we did every night you would have to lean over the railing and look sideways to see the Opera House. Rooms to the right of #335 down to around #354 have full Opera House views and partial bridge views but no city views. Rooms to the right of about #354 have only partial or no Opera House view. Rooms at the other end of the S-shaped hallway toward the bridge have Opera House views as well as bridge views. Then there are some rooms with just water views but without the Opera House or bridge or city. The rooms on floors 2 and 3 presumably would have the same setup but I didn't see them. The best thing to do is call the hotel directly on one of the "dial around" numbers like 1010987 and you can confirm for yourself the exact view of the rooms-it only costs about $2USD to talk for about 10 minutes. Don't waste your time calling the Hyatt toll-free central reservation number--they haven't the foggiest idea of the layout of the rooms or which way they face. The hotel's direct number from the US is 011-61-2-9256-1101. -Speaking of balconies, every third room facing the water has only a small semicircular balcony with no chairs or tables so if you plan on using the balcony on a regular basis you should consider the rooms with the larger balconies with furniture. Also, the top floor (level #4)balconies have a pergola-type overhang which lets rain and other things falling from the sky onto the balcony. If it's raining you couldn't use it and if it rains at night the chair cushions will be wet the next day. However, the balconies on the first and second floors (levels 2 and 3) have a fully-covered overhang from the balcony above. -The balcony rooms also have double sliding and locking glass doors which removes 100% of the noise of the harbour. -We arrived by cruise ship which docked at the overseas passenger terminal only a 3 minute walk away. I walked over to the hotel and got the bellman to come over in the hotel car to pick up our luggage and take it back to the hotel. -The hotel has a convenient location for many Sydney sights-10 minutes to the BridgeClimb office -5 minutes to the weekend market at The Rocks -20 minutes to the Opera House -10 minutes to Circular Quay -10 minutes to the Hero of Waterloo pub The congierge staff is first class-they can arrange the BridgeClimb or set up private tours to Hunter Valley or the Blue Mountains using their recommended guides and drivers. They will also make a heavy-duty electrical converter/adapter available for your appliances. -The only negative we found was the exorbitant price of breakfast. Easily to overcome-there are several sidewalk cafes in the Rocks and along Circular Quay that are a 5-10 minute walk away. Additionally, there are several lunch and dinner restaurants right outside the harbourside hotel entrance. -When going to the airport the hotel can set you up with their limo for $90 or you can just have them get a street taxi for about $40. -When checking in I asked for and received a further 10% senior citizens discount off the room rate. At these prices that paid for our wine tour to Hunter Valley. -In summary, this is all about location and 5 star views. I thought it was worth it. You'll remember the view the rest of your life.

Reviews.Title: “best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: cotswoldstraveller
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt Sydney â€“ stayed in October 2005 for 2 nights â€“ have stayed before and will stay again â€“ probably the best Hyatt Iâ€™ve ever stayed in and given itâ€™s stunning location probably the best high end hotel for tourists in Sydney â€“ the rooms are large and well equipped with many having the best views in Sydney. Itâ€™s a modern hotel but well done and the competent band attentive staff make it a really excellent experience

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: BryceCurdy
Reviews.Content: Well actually 4 and a half out of 5. The location is simply unbeatable. I found the staff very helpful despite the comments of at least one other reviewer. Early check in was no problem and I had specifically asked for a good view of the Harbour Bridge which we definitely got. The rooms are excellent. We ate once in the restaurant and had a very nice if slightly pricey lunch. Only two criticisms. The rooftop pool is very small. There is only a total of ten loungers. Secondly some of the rooms (about a third) have only very small balconies with no seating.

Reviews.Title: “Cool weekend”
Reviews.Author: ithaki
Reviews.Content: Have not stayed here for years but were impressed with our reception. An early check-in was no problem even though an early business meeting meant we did not require this. Divine room with balcony view onto the inner harbour. We stayed a long weekend and it was a delight to observe all of the weddings below when we were at our room. Despite the opening balcony doors the room was so quite and dark at night - easy to catch up lost sleep. Bed was divine and room extremely good value. As we love to walk a lot the bath was really appreciated to soak in at night. Next trip will use the excellent spa facilities. Staff were very helpful and pleasant but unobtrussive. Check in/out was very low key - much appreciated. We dined out with local business colleagues but you would be wise to check out the restaurant menu - excellent choices if you are gastronomically challenged. Looking forward to a repeat stay next month.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere better on the Opera House side, but make sure you get the right room !”
Reviews.Author: LawyerAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt for 3 nights in an Opera Deluxe King Room, and had a fantastic, if costly (c Â£375 per night), stay. It is the best positioned hotel in Sydney on the Opera House side. A real treat, though probably a one-off for a non-business traveller due to cost. The Views - be careful what room you get! This hotel's big selling point is its location off Circular Quay and the Opera House views. This was a special occasion and we wanted to be sure of a direct opera house view, so we booked (direct with the hotel) the "guaranteed" direct view of an "opera deluxe king".
