Unfortunately we arrived later than most and ended up with the poorest of that grade - and discovered that there are two "bunches" of this room grade in the hotel. The ones at the North end are the closest to the opera house and have the best and widest views often including the Harbour Bridge (PIC 1), but there are some at the other end, further away and whose views can (as we found) be partially obscured by visting yachts etc and other bits of the hotel (PIC 2). Sounds picky, but you pay through the nose for the view at this hotel, so make sure you hassle them for one at the north end! Thankfully, we were swapped to one at the North end after the first night. The rooms The rooms are absolutely fantastic with huge marble bathrooms, (good toiletries, bath and separate shower), and great entertainment system (Widescreen TV/DVD). The deluxe rooms also have a massive king bed which is extremely comfortable. Ours had the advantage of not having to get out of bed to see the Opera House at dawn (a must-do) Meals Food is excellent. The restaurant has the same great view, and the food was very good. Breakfast is superb - everything about it is superbly done, and the service was great. If you're a light eater at breakfast, you'll feel cheated - single items (eg if you wanted a glass of juice) were expensive, but the full buffet was around AUD$45 (Â£20-ish) which is cheap by London hotel standards. Room service was prompt and the food very good too. Swimming Pool There is a roof top pool, but frankly its too small to swim in ! Its pretty disappointing when you get up there and the view isn't as good as you think - the draw seems to be the jacuzzi on the roof which gives some kind of view, but that wasn't our cup of tea ! Service generally - Our one gripe.... Generally service was very good indeed - easily the best we experienced on our holiday. The concierge's desk in particular was excellent, whether it was stamps for postcards, couriering documents back to the UK, or just getting directions or a taxi. However, some of the front desk staff, in our view, need an attitude adjustment. Our inital request for a room change (above) was treated dismissively and unhelpfully by one front desk member, almost as if we were lucky to be staying at the hotel, rather than paying a hell of a lot of money for it. We were told that nothing could be done - very disappointing. Thankfully, in our case, the front of house manager sorted us out quite easily, suggesting that the problem was really one of attiutude and being bothered. Had we stayed in our "old" room, we would have had a very different feeling about our stay. Overall though, a very nice stay. Alternatives If you're after something at better value at Circular Quay and don't want to end up in a tower block like the Shangri-La or Intercontinental, the Quay Grand Suites {---} are often good value for a one-bed harbour view suite at about Â£240 per night. We stayed there on a previous trip and thoroughly enjoyed being at the heart of activity at Circular Quay. If you're not worried about being on the Opera Harbour front, there are several good hotels at Darling Harbour (not as far away as you might think) which also have good views. We stayed 3 nights at the Four Points Sheraton in a Maritime Studio room for under Â£420 for the whole stay inc breakfast - I've done a separate review of that. If we go back, we're staying there again, it really is superb - as good as the Park Hyatt for everything except a direct view of the opera house. Have a great time Michael PS We also stayed at the Sebel Pier One (another review)- my advice, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MasterGee
Reviews.Content: An unbelievable location (across Circular Quay from the famed Opera House), excellent service, and all the comforts you expect from a top notch hotel make this property one of the very best in Sydney. I absolutely love this place and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Opera View Suite”
Reviews.Author: Ricanth
Reviews.Content: Great Location. I have also stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney and while the Club floor has a great view, the Intercontinental does not compare to the Park Hyatt. My wife and I got an Opera View Suite which was around 600 SF. Two balconies with great views. One of the coolest things was we cam home back from dinner at Otto's (I recommend) and there was a Michael Buble concert at the Opera House. We were able to listen from our balcony while having some wine. The food was OK and very expensive. I recommend walking around the corner to Pancakes on the Rocks and getting some Chocolate Pancakes with Ice cream and strawberries for dinner. In addition there are cafe's all over the Rocks District. The workout facility was clean and while it had limited equipment, there was noone using it, ever. Go to the Rocks Market on Saturday/Sunday from 10AM-5PM for great souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “what a view!”
Reviews.Author: kazpalms
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the Park Hyatt after a dreadful journey via Los Angeles. What a delight to arrive in our harbour view room! We were blown away by the sheer scale of the room, the view and the comfort. Our two children had an adjoining room, smaller but with much the same view. Our room was just fantastic though - two balconies, enormous, deeply comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom. We found the staff unfailing helpful, esp the concierges, and always went out of their way to help (even provided us with the name and location of a local launderette so we didnt have to pay hotel prices for laundry!). Restaurant staff v helpful at breakfast (we ate out at night). Ideal position in the Rocks area of town - can walk to Opera House and harbour for ferries and otherwise excellent bus connections. We loved Sydney and would love to return and would def stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hyatt Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 7 Hickson Road | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
